loans.use: to buy milk, chocolate and sugar.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 23-year-old, single mother of one. She was orphaned at a young age, and as a result, grew up in abject poverty. She recalls having one meal per day, and sometimes no meal at all. Alice says her experience has given her the drive and motivation to be hardworking.

Alice wants to change her life and that of her family by starting her own business as a Zoona mobile money agent in Chingola, Zambia.

Alice's business will deal in mobile money transfers; this means that people in her hometown of Chingola will go to her trading kiosk to send and receive money to and from their loved ones. Most people send money across the country for medical emergencies, school fees, business purposes and to support extended families by providing funds for their day-to-day supplies. Alice will play a vital role in ensuring that people are able to access financial services when they need to most.

Alice has requested her first Kiva loan in order to procure a trading kiosk and have the funds needed to serve people. Currently, Alice does not have the necessary capital needed to execute her vision and main objective of running her own business. Being able to run her own business will allow Alice to be able to provide for her child.

Alice thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to acquire capital in order to procure a trading kiosk and have the funds needed to serve customers so that she can start running her own business in Chingola, Zambia.

loans.name: New Stead Family Group

texts.en:
Fredica is a member of New Stead solidarity group. (See group picture; Fredica stands in the middle.) Fredica is 37 years old, married and has two childen, age 15 and 12 years old.

She sells food. Fredica has been selling food stuff for the past nine years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay for her children’s education and to provide for her family. She has been able to buy a piece of land from savings she made from her business.

Fredica and other group members of New Stead Family solidarity group are requesting their first loan. Fredica and her group members are in need of a loan of 7,500,000 SLL. Of this amount, Fredica will personally receive 1,500,000 SLL which she will use to purchase more crates of drinks and other hard drinks, etc. for her business.

Fredica hopes that her business continues to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and educate her children well.

Fredica and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of drinks and other hard drinks.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hadi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hadi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hadi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hadi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Hadi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sule has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sule would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sule can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sule will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Sule is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lyakahungu Transporters Group

texts.en:
Yosani, an adult married man, lives in Kamwenge, Uganda.

He deals in produce and carpentry as his main sources of income and he also supplements his income with farming, which he uses to cater for his family needs.

His highest dream is to advance his standard of living and have his children educated. He faces a challenge of price changes of his products.

Yosani hopes to have all his children educated to higher levels of education from the profits made and also promises to pay his loan installments on time. He is requesting for a loan to obtain new beans for the next season for his produce shop.

He is a member of Lyakahungu Transporters Group where they practice group guarantorship.

loans.use: to obtain new beans for the next season for his produce shop.

loans.name: Muziizi Klezia Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Unice is the only female member in the group. She is a very hardworking 36-year-old married woman with children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

She operates a restaurant with the help of the group guarantorship to boost it. She has 10 years in the business and she has achieved a lot with it, alongside farming for additional income.

She is a committed executive leader who has persisted with the group since its foundation, when there were more than 15 members.

This woman works tirelessly in order to sustain her family needs and will feel satisfied when she achieves her dreams, like educating her children up to university and having a well organized hotel serving many people from different places.

Unice is requesting the loan to buy more items for her restaurant like chairs, tables, saucepans and plates.

loans.use: to buy more items like chairs, tables, saucepans and plates to use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Chishala

texts.en:
Chishala is a 38-year-old father of one who operates his own mobile transfer business in Lusaka, Zambia.  With the depreciation of the Zambian currency in recent times, Chishala’s business has been struggling financially.  Inflated transport and rent costs are but two of the things affecting his business at the present time.  He has a child in primary school and because of the state of the Zambian economy, tuition fees has doubled.  He is struggling to keep his family afloat. 

Currently, Chishala uses the revenue generated by his Zoona outlets to generate capital in order to expand his business and be a source of employment in his community.  He would like to, someday, see his child financially stable and he would like to continue to be a source of youth employment in his community.  Being able to run his own business has allowed Chishala to support his family but he has seen his momentum falter because of the state of the Zambian economy.  He is now looking to build on his capital base and progressively have his outlets become more lucrative.

A huge challenge for Chishala is the constant float shortages he currently experiences, especially when assisting a client who needs to send a large sum of money.  This results in him losing clients to other mobile money transfer competitors and also results in his clients losing faith in his services.  It also results in him having to close his outlets early and send clients home because he is unable to assist them.  These are not the values he wishes to embody. 

Therefore, Chishala is requesting his first Kiva loan in order to have the funds needed for him to grow his business and serve people who need access to efficient financial services.

Chishala thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to acquire capital in order to grow his mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Joyce School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Dickson. He is the head teacher of Joyce Primary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Mbale with 180 students.

Joyce Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have consistent access to clean drinking water and, therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Joyce Primary School will repay its loan from school fees, which are collected each term. Dickson ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Alhaji Yahaya

texts.en:
Alhaji Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Yahaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Yahaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Alhaji Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alhaji Shehu

texts.en:
Alhaji Shehu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Shehu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Shehu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Shehu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Alhaji Shehu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Obby

texts.en:
Obby is 24 years old. He completed his high school education with great difficulty as a result of being orphaned at very young age. He is now looking to empower himself. He would like to start running his own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent and needs a loan from Kiva to make this dream a reality.

Obby has successfully completed training with Zoona to start running his own business. Once he gets the Kiva loan, he will set up his business in Ndola, Zambia. Zoona has done market research and has found that the location in which Obby is looking to open his new outlet would be ideal not only for employment opportunities for people in the community but also for the traction he needs to be profitable.

Obby is requesting for a Kiva loan in order to have the capital he needs to start running his own business. The funds will be used to purchase a trading kiosk and serve as a float for customers who need to send and receive money from his outlet. Obby will use the anticipated profits from his business to provide for his basic needs such as food, clothes and bills.

loans.use: to purchase a trading kiosk and serve as a float for customers who need to send and receive money from his outlet.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
At 23, Emmanuel is the sole breadwinner in his family of three.  His mother passed away when he was very young and this meant that his father had to make some difficult sacrifices in order to pay for schooling for himself and his brother.  Emmanuel is very passionate about wanting to be a successful entrepreneur and this vision has shaped the life he now leads, and has kept him disciplined and focused. 

Emmanuel is an emerging entrepreneur, operating his own Zoona mobile money transfer business.  His business provides financial services to people in his community that do not have access to banking.  Emmanuel loves his business because it gives him a chance to learn a lot of things from the different people he meets on a daily basis.  He says his community benefits from his business because they do not have to move long distances to access financial services and his services are very easy to use and not intimidating.  He operates one Zoona outlet and can be found at his outlet on a daily basis. 

Emmanuel’s biggest challenge is that he does not have enough money in his business to serve his customers, and the trading booth he is using to complete transactions is not one that he owns.  Therefore, he is requesting his first Kiva loan to help him purchase a Zoona branded trading booth.  He will use the rest of the money to serve customers with additional financial float.  

Emmanuel is excited to be connected to Kiva lenders.  He sees this as a huge opportunity for the growth of his business.  He is hopeful that once his loan comes in, he will serve more customers and earn additional profit.  The profit helps Emmanuel take care of his family and improve their standard of living.  His dream is to expand his business to places that do not yet have mobile money outlets.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona mobile money trading booth and add to the funds that he uses to serve customers.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio con 65 años de edad,de estado civil viudo, vive en casa propia de material rústico,en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cuál no tendrá problemas en vender su producto. Adicionalmente se dedica a cultivos como maíz, frejol, yuca, rocoto ingresos adicionales que le permites solventar el crédito.

Gregorio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con aval.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 65 years old, a widower, who lives in his own rustic house in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, country Perú. The area has many good personal references for working for the inhabitants of the area. The majority of the inhabitants of this locality make a living in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He makes a living in agriculture, specifically cultivating coffee, with experience in the position for 8 years. The loan that you give him will be used in agricultural labors, applications and incorporations of pesticide products, fertilizers, and workers for his harvest. In this way you will help him to improve the physiology, morphology, and production of his crop, in this way he will also have a timely harvest, and as a result he will have more production, a better quality of product, and he won't have problems selling his product. Additionally he works cultivating corn, beans, yuca, rocoto peppers, additional income that allow him to settle his credit.

Gregorio is a recurring partner for Edpyme Alternativa. Signature with guarantee.

loans.use: he will use it in agricultural work, applications and incorporations of pesticide products, fertilizers, and workforce for his harvest.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: Rosendo tiene 46 años de edad y vive con su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos tres niñas de 12, 10 y 6 años y un varón de 17 años de edad. Él se esfuerza cada día para llevar el sustento a su familia, por lo que desde hace 17 años se gana la vida en una empresa cercana. Rosendo logro hace poco instalar el agua potable a su vivienda, pero esta carece de una pila y un baño, por lo que él ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, tuberías, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir la pila y el baño de su vivienda y cuidar de la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en: Rosendo is 46 years old and he lives with his life's companion and their 4 children: three daughters, aged 12, 10 an6 and a 17 year old boy. He strives every day to support his family. For 17 years, he has been earning a living at a nearby business. Not long ago, Rosendo was able to install running, potable water in his house, but it is lacking a sink and a bathroom. He has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, pipes, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build the sink and the bathroom in his house to care for his home's hygiene.

loans.use: to in cement, pipes, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a sink and bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is married woman, age 40, living in Osu Accra.

She operates a retail shop, mostly selling cooking oil, salt, soap, and general merchandise among other items. She also ventured into wholesale so as to raise more income for her family and to have more food security in her area. However, high rental fees and stiff competition affect her business returns.

Gifty started business 10 years ago on realizing a need to supplement her income. Her dream is to develop and expand her business so as to improve the standard of living of her family.

She is seeking a loan to buy more soap, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Abdulrashid

texts.en:
Abdulrashid is a maize farmer from Hayin Allahuwa village. As a Babban Gona member, Abdulrashid is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulrashid would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Abdulrashid can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Abdulrashid no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Abdulrashid hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Babangida

texts.en:
Babangida is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Babangida is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Babangida would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Babangida can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Babangida has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Babangida is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to provide healthcare for his family and children, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora de 51 años de edad, casada con tres hijos. Es costurera desde hace mas de veinte años de edad. También  esta a cargo de su papa quien enviudo, sus hermanas se encargan de cuidar a su papa mientras ella trabaja, el señor perdió la vista desde antes de que falleciera su esposa. Ella esta muy preocupada por su papa ya que necesita un tratamiento quirúrgico para poder recuperar la vista, lamentablemente sus recursos no le alcanzan.
texts.en:
She is 51 years old, married, and has three children. She has been a seamstress for over 20 years. Her father, a widow, is also under her care. Her sisters take care of her father while she works. He lost his vision before his wife died.

She is very worried about her father. He needs surgical treatment in order to be able to recover his vision. Unfortunately, she does not enough resources for this.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a maize farmer from Soba village in Kaduna, Nigeria.  As a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organizaion, Andrew is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer.  With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Andrew would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing.  With Babban Gona’s support, Andrew can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Andrew is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
La señora María Félix  de  59  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 14 años a la actividad de moler maíz en su molino.
Doña María Félix se levanta muy temprano para moler el maíz, es una mujer trabajadora y bien humilde que se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante años, con este molino pudo pagarle los estudios a sus hijos y ayudar a su familia.
Doña María Félix está solicitando el préstamo para compra de repuestos para el molino y un motor nuevo para otro molino que tiene, también quiere comprar maíz, leña para revender,  con el apoyo del préstamo espera poder mejorar su molino y seguir trabajando para el sostén de su familia, es un buen cliente que solicita su séptimo préstamo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
María Félix is 59 years old. She lives with her husband and their children in the community of San Lorenzo, in a valley in southern Honduras. For 14 years ahs has worked grinding corn at her mill.

María Félix gets up very early to grind the corn. She is a hardworking, very humble woman who has worked at this activity for several years. With this mill, she has been able to pay for her children's education and help her family.

María Félix is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts for the mill and a new motor for another mill that she has. She also want to buy corn and firewood to re-sell. With the help of the loan, she hopes to be able to improve her mill and continue working to support her family. She is a good client who is asking for her seventh loan.



San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2015.

loans.use: to buy replacement part for a mill, a motor, as well as corn and firewood for her business.

loans.name: International Group

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Sideratu. She is married and has six children. Her children are all school-going children. (In the group picture, Sideratu is on the right.)

Sideratu established her drinks and water business six years ago. She established the business to ensure that her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Sideratu is a hardworking woman. She opens her business from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Monday through Saturday every week.

Sideratu uses profits from this business to provide livelihood for her family and support her children’s education.

Sideratu belongs to a solidarity group of four women who have come together to help each other achieve their individual dreams. “International” is the name of Sideratu’s solidarity group.

“International” group needs a total loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Sideratu will receive 1,250,000 SLL, which she needs in order to purchase five bags of groundnuts, two bags of pepper, 300 bundles of water, 50 crates of soft drinks, etc. for her business.

In the future, Sideratu plans to support her children to acquire university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international businesswoman. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of groundnuts, two bags of pepper, 300 bundles of water, etc.

loans.name: Karla Johana

texts.es: Karla, tiene 28 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 4 hijos y reside en un sector de Choloma, Cortes. Desde joven ella se ha dedicado al comercio para obtener ingresos, lleva aproximadamente 15 años de vender verduras y frutas. Esta actividad la realiza en un puesto frente a su casa, ofrece variedad de verduras y frutas como ser cebollas, chiles, tomates, papas, patastes, yuca, repollo, bananos, aguacates, sandia, naranjas y también refrescos. Solicita el segundo ciclo de préstamo en ODEF por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más producto  en verduras y frutas frescas como cebolla, chile, tomate, banano, aguacate, repollo, papas, naranjas etc. Para surtir y siempre tener ventas y con una parte del préstamo también va invertir en poner un taller para reparación de bicicletas, ya que en la zona utilizan este medio de transporte y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Su sueño es crecer económicamente y salir adelante con sus hijos, teniendo una vida mejor.
texts.en: Karla is 28 years old, lives in a civil union with her husband with whom she has 4 children and resides in a sector of Choloma, Cortes. Since she was young she has been working in business to obtain income, she has approximately 15 years selling vegetables and fruits. She does this activity in a position in front of her house, she offers a variety of vegetables and fruits such as onions, chilies, tomatoes, potatoes, patastes, yuca, cabbage, bananas, avocados, watermelon, oranges, and also sodas. She is requesting her second round of loans from ODEF for the amount of 15,000 Lempiras, with which she is going to buy more product in vegetables and fresh fruits such as onion, chilies, tomatoes, bananas, avocado, cabbage, potatoes, oranges, etc. To stock and always have sales with a part of the loan she is also going to invest it in installing a bicycle repair shop, since in this area people use this mode of transportation and she will count on her husband's help. Her dream is to grow economically and get ahead with her children, having a better life.

loans.use: to buy onions, chiles, tomatoes, bananas, avocados, cabbage, and other things for the business and she will invest one part in installing a bicycle repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El tiene 21 años de edad es casado, su esposa esta embarazada de ocho meses. Trabaja como almacenista, ha usado casi toda su vida anteojos por la miopía que padece. Los lentes que utiliza son lentes muy caros por la dioptrías negativas que tiene, el especialista recomienda una cirugía para solucionar su problema. El único inconveniente es que de momento no cuenta con los recursos necesarios, por el próximo nacimiento de su hijo.
texts.en:
He is 21 years old and married. His wife is eight months pregnant. He works as a storekeeper. He has used glasses almost all of his life for the myopia that he has. The glasses that he uses are very expensive because of the negative diopters that he has.

The specialist recommends surgery to solve his problem. The only drawback is that he does not have the needed resources due to the coming birth of his child.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in Kaduna, Nigeria.  Anticipating a good harvest this season, Martha has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Martha would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing.  Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Martha can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more money than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Martha will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land.  Martha is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family, and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children obtain a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alpha Schools

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Lucky. He is the director of Alpha Schools, mixed schools in the urban area of Matugga in Wakiso with 450 students.

Alpha Schools has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for the students. The schools do not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore, have to spend a considerable portion of their budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing two water filtration systems will therefore save the schools money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 450-liter tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Alpha Schools will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Lucky ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for the students.

loans.name: Ntare School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jimmy. He is the head teacher of Ntare School, a boys school in the urban area of Mbarara with 1,600 students.

Ntare School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with a 750 and 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Ntare School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jimmy ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Blanca Sonia

texts.es: Con 35 años de edad Blanca muestra cada día sus deseos de salir adelante, es por ello que desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, lo cual le permite estar pendiente de su familia y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos una niña de 12 años y un varón de 10 años de edad. Blanca ha logrado construir su vivienda poco a poco, por lo que aún no ha logrado instalar la energía eléctrica y las ventanas de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ventanas, caja térmica, cable eléctrico y mano de obra para construir instalar energía eléctrica y ventanas en su vivienda.
texts.en: At 35 years old, Blanca  shows how she wants to get ahead every day. That is why for four years, she has sold beauty products via catalog. This allows her to care for her family and help with the household expenses. She lives with her life's companion and their two children, a 12 year old girl and a 10 year old boy. Blanca has been able to build her home little by little, but she still hasn't been able to install electricity and windows in her home. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in windows, a thermal box, electrical cable, and to pay for labor to install electricity and windows in her home.

loans.use: to invest in windows, a thermal box, electrical cable, and to pay for labor to install electricity and windows in her home.

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es:
Bacilio con 42 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una unidad móvil de su propiedad (mototaxi), cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con una pequeña finca de cacao. El préstamo lo utilizará en el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil.

Bacilio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Bacilio is 42 years old, in a common-law relationship, and lives in his own home with his partner. They live in the Pomahuaca district, in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of Peru. The people from his area mainly work in agriculture, trade and livestock. He has very good personal and employment references from the inhabitants of the area. 

He works providing public transportation services using his own mobile unit (mototaxi). He has more than 5 years of experience in this area, and so has a lot of experience in this field. Additionally, he works in agriculture, with his own small cocoa farm. 

The loan will be used to maintain his mototaxi. Bacilio is a recurrent partner for Edpyme Alternativa, and he and his spouse have co-signed the loan.

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is 32 years old. He is the sole bread winner in a family of seven and has one child. He enjoys helping people and is very passionate about running a successful business and becoming a nurse.

Luka operates his own Zoona mobile money-transfer business in Lusaka, Zambia. His business provides financial services to people in his community.

Luka began running his own business nine years ago, selling timber. He added the business of mobile money transfers to boost his income, as his profit margins were very low and he struggled to provide basic needs for his family.

Today, the combined incomes from his two businesses help Luka earn a decent living and he has enrolled himself to study nursing.

Luka is requesting a loan from Kiva because he wants to pay for his trading kiosk, which he currently uses to make his transactions but has not paid for, because he lacks capital. This loan will also help Luka to increase the money that he has to serve customers in his business.

Adding capital to his mobile money transfer business will help Luka earn more commissions and help him take his child to school and continue to pay for his nursing diploma. He is hopeful that this will improve his standard of living. He sees his mobile money business as a good first step in becoming a successful businessman. Luka thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a trading booth and serve customers who need to access financial services.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi lives in Vanadzor town with her husband. They got involved in providing tourism service three years ago. They offer various interesting tour services to their customers. They organise hiking tours, car tours and other types of services in all regions of Armenia.

Both Varduhi and her husband are enthusiastic workers, so they have a number of partner companies, such as hotels working together and providing a customer base for them.

The loan Varduhi requested will be helpful for this couple to purchase a bicycle, tents and sleeping bags for providing tours in Armenia. They hope for your support.

loans.use: to pay for a bicycle, tents and sleeping bags for providing tours in Armenia to tourists and locals.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un joven que dejo pendiente su tratamiento de ortodoncia por falta de recursos, lo que le afecto mas su dentadura actualmente sus dientes se encuentran muy desalineados y sufre de inflamación en las encías y fuerte dolor. El es un joven estudiante y al mismo tiempo trabaja como almacenista, sin embargo sus recursos son insuficientes para seguir con el tratamiento ya que es el único sustento de su mama quien es viuda.
texts.en:
He is a young man who left his orthodontic treatment pending due to lack of resources. This further affected his teeth, and now they are very misaligned. He has inflamed gums and severe pain.

He is a student, and he also works as a shopkeeper. Nevertheless, he does not have enough resources for the treatment. This is because he is the sole support of his mother, who is a widow.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES  UNA MADRE DE FAMILIA QUE ACTUALMENTE SUFRE DE FUERTES DOLORES DENTALES DEBIDO AL DESGASTE QUE PADECE EN SUS DIENTES, ESTO TAMBIÉN LE PROVOCA FUERTES DOLORES DE CABEZA, LO QUE EN OCASIONES LE IMPIDE ASISTIR A SU TRABAJO, LABORA COMO INTENDENTE EN UNA FABRICA POR LO QUE SUS RECURSOS NO LE ALCANZAN PARA COSTEAR EL TRATAMIENTO DENTAL QUE NECESITA PARA PODER RECUPERAR SU SALUD DENTAL.
texts.en:
She is a mother who currently suffers from severe dental pain due to the wearing down of her teeth. This also causes severe headaches. Sometimes this keeps her from going to her work as a supervisor at a factory.

She does not have enough resources to pay for the dental treatment that she needs to be able to recover her dental health.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De La Zona A Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “LAS ESTRELLITAS DE LA ZONA A” está conformada por 05 socias entusiastas. Este es el caso de MARIA de 33 años de edad, separada con 02 hijos. Maria es una madre empeñosa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trata de sacar adelante a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de helados de raspadilla. El deseo de Maria es ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de azúcar y saborizantes. El grupo “LAS ESTRELLITAS DE LA ZONA A” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Maria es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo color rojo.
texts.en: Five enthusiastic members make up the communal bank called “LAS ESTRELLITAS DE LA ZONA A” .  This is the story of Maria who is 33 years old. She is separated and has two children. Maria is a diligent mother who through a great deal of effort and dedication is trying to provide for her family. She makes a living from selling snow cones. Maria wants to expand her business. She has applied for a loan to buy sugar and flavourings. The “LAS ESTRELLITAS DE LA ZONA A” group is grateful for the support that provided by Kiva. Maria is on the far left of the picture wearing a red T -shirt.

loans.use: to buy sugar and flavourings.

loans.name: Flor Del Carmen

texts.es:
Flor utilizo el crédito anterior para fabricar una ramada en la que se mantenía vendiendo más sandías y otros productos que compro con el resto del crédito, todo estaba marchando muy bien, pero como su negocio estaba ubicado en la carretera,  cierto día un vehículo perdió el control y se estrelló con su negocio, debido a dicho evento ella decidió dedicarse a administrar otro negocio como lo es el de ofrecer el servicio de taller para vehículos, además arrenda el equipo a otras personas para tener mejores ingresos.
Necesita de un nuevo crédito, que en esta ocasión piensa utilizar en la compra de una pistola de presión, una destornilladora, una bomba de aire y también mandara a reparar otras herramientas, esta inversión le permitirá seguir progresando y mejorando su nuevo rubro para subsistir.
texts.en:
Flor used the previous loan to make a stall from which to sell watermelons and other products bought with the rest of the loan.
Everything was going well but, one day, a vehicle crashed into her stall, which was located on the side of the road.
Flor thus changed tack and decided to start a new business; she nows has a vehicle maintenance shop.
She also rents out her equipment to increase her income.
She needs a new loan to buy a high pressure water hose, an electric screwdriver, and an air pump. 
She will also use the loan to repair other tools.
This will enable her to keep expanding her new business and sole source of income.

loans.use: to buy a high pressure water hose, an electric screwdriver, and an air pump, and to repair other tools.

loans.name: Philibus

texts.en:
Philibus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Philibus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Philibus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Philibus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Philibus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Philibus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Pennfoster School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Daphne. She is the Head Teacher of Pennfoster School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Bunamyaya with 300 students. Pennfoster School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultra filtration water treatment system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and, therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an ultra filtration water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Pennfoster School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Daphne ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Berthine

texts.fr:
Berthine est une femme entreprenante de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et vit à la campagne avec ses 5 enfants. Elle cultive du riz, du mais, des haricots et du manioc. Elle pratique de l’élevage bovin et de la volaille.
Cela fait 3 ans que Berthine est emprunteuse chez Vahatra. Les prêts d’avant lui ont permis de cultiver la terre et d’avoir assez de bénéfice pour assurer l’éducation de ses enfants. Ce prêt servira à acheter une vache laitière, ce qui peut être une rentrée d’argent en plus qui lui conduira à l’autonomie financière.
Berthine se bat pour offrir un meilleur avenir pour ces 5 enfants
texts.en:
Berthine is an enterprising, 46-year-old woman. She is married with 5 children and lives in the countryside. She cultivates rice, maize, beans and cassava. She also raises cattle and poultry. 

Berthine has been borrowing with Vahatra for 3 years. Her previous loans have allowed her to cultivate land and to earn enough for her children's education. This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow, which will bring in more income and allow for more financial independence. 

Berthine strives to offer her 5 children a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: G.s Los Cedros Group

texts.es:
El señor Jose tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, tiene casa propia, en una comunidad de Trojes, El Paraíso, al Oriente de Honduras, Su actividad principal es la caficultura, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 20 años de la cual ha adquirido muy buen conocimiento por su excelente desempeño.

Don Jose  actualmente cuenta con 3 manzanas  de café para esta proxima cosecha el espera aumentar su producción, con el crédito que esta solicitando quiere comprar abono y fertilizantes, tiene como proyecto la siembra de 2,500.00 plantas de café y asi obtener una mejor producción en los próximos años y poder mejorar sus ingresos en su hogar.
Don Jose  su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia.
Don Yodin se dedica a la agricultura.
Don Nohel se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años.
Doña Meysis se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años.

Trojes, Honduras -  Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
José, 37, lives with his spouse and their three children in a house of his own, in Trojes, El Paraíso, in the eastern part of Honduras.
He has been growing coffee for twenty years and is a very experienced farmer who produces high-quality beans.
José currently grows his coffee on 3 hectares of land and hopes to increase production for the coming harvest.
He will use the loan to buy manure and fertiliser; he ambitions to plant 2,500 coffee plants and thus increase production in the coming years to bring more money home.
José's dream is to improve his family's standard of living.
Yodin is a farmer. Nohel has been a farmer for many years; so has Meysis.
Trojes, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to buy manure and fertiliser.

loans.name: Jilma Dianet

texts.es:
LLa señora Jilma es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio, el cual es la venta de abarrotería y también elabora pan,  este negocio lo atiende de manera personal.
Doña Jilma tiene su negocio desde hace 30 años, teniendo como  sus principales clientes los vecinos de la comunidad, solicita el apoyo del Préstamo para la compra de producto para surtir su negocio como ser: harina, manteca, huevos, aceite, condimentos, refrescos, jugos, churros etc. 
Jilma sueña con poder ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en el negocio más surtido de toda la comunidad.

Danli, Honduras -  Octubre del  2015
texts.en:
Jilma is an enterprising woman dedicated to commerce. Her main source of income is her business which is a grocery store where she also bakes and sells bread. She works in her business by herself.

Jilma has had this business for 30 years. Her customers are mainly the neighbors in her community.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies to stock her store, such as flour, lard, eggs, oil, seasoning, soft drinks, juice, fried dough, etc.

Jilma dreams of expanding her business so it becomes the best-stocked store in the community.

Danli, Honduras - October, 2015

loans.use: buy flour, lard, eggs, oil, seasoning, soft drinks, juice, fried dough, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Bertha Eunise

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Eunise de 40  años de edad es casada y  vive con su familia  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de mercadería como ropa en general camisas, pantalones, bóxer, toallas, ropa de niños y todo tipo de artículos para el hogar, vive en una Aldea al sur de Honduras.
Doña Bertha Eunise es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Bertha Eunise está solicitando el préstamo para compra de más productos como blusas, pantalones, camisas, zapatos, etc. para surtir su negocio y poder atender con más satisfacción a sus clientes,  con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido para mejorar sus ingresos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Bertha Eunise, 40, is married and lives with her family in a house of her own.
She has been selling clothes for ten years: shirts, trousers, boxers, towels, children's clothes and other household items.
She lives in a village in the southern part of Honduras.
Bertha Eunise is a women entrepreneur who struggles to improve her lot in life and her standard of living.
She asks for a loan to buy more blouses, trousers, shirts, shoes, etc. for her shop.
She wants to offer a wider choice to her customers.
Thanks to this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living.
This is her first loan with the field partner.
Bertha Eunise's dream is to have a nice shop with lots of stock to increase her income.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Loegiman

texts.en:
Loegiman is 60 years old. He lives together with his wife and two children, and works as a field worker at a banana company. In his spare time, he planted rice on a land of 8 hectares. This is an extra income for the family.

With the income from previous seasons, Loegiman bought a second-hand pickup truck. He has now expanded his rice areas and requests from Seva MFI a loan of SRD 6,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer from Hayin Malam Garba village. As a Babban Gona member, Saratu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Saratu can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Saratu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Saratu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yenis Marina

texts.es:
La señora Yenis tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 2  hijos y vive con su esposo de en una aldea de Trojes al Oriente de Honduras, su actividad principal es la siembra y cuenta con mucha experiencia.
Doña Yenis es una persona muy responsable y respetada por su buen conportamiento en la comunidad, necesita el prestamo para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para su negocio, porque para este tiempo le da muy buenas ganancias.
Doña Yenis tiene una finca cafetalera junto con su esposo, espera que esta inversion le ayude a salir adente con su familia y poder obetener los ingresos necesarios.


Trojes, Honduras – Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
Yenis is 30 years old. She has 2 children and lives with her husband in a small village of Trojes, located East of Honduras. She mainly works in agriculture and she has a lot of experience.

Yenis is a very responsible person who has the respect of the people in her community due to her good behavior. She needs the loan to buy fertilizer and compost for her business because during this time she makes good profit.

Yenis has a coffee plantation with her husband. With this investment she hopes to get the income she needs to help her family get ahead in life.

Trojes, Honduras - November, 2015

loans.use: buy fertilizer and compost for her business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 39 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, candies, noodles, bread, milk, sugar, cigarettes and other snack foods.

In the future Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, candies, noodles, bread, milk, sugar, cigarettes and other snack foods.

loans.name: Ana Betty

texts.es:
Ana ha  sabido utilizar los créditos y las ganancias, por lo que su negocio de venta de tortillas mantiene su continuidad, ella ha podido cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y ha logrado darle educación a sus hijos, pues ya uno de ellos se gradúo de bachillerato y otro ya casi lo finaliza, se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que la institución le ha dado brindado.
En estos momentos no cuenta con la liquidez suficiente para fortalecer su negocio, por tal razón hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar una plancha industrial con la que la productividad de tortillas será mayor y atenderá las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana used loans and profits wisely to keep her tortilla-selling business going.
She was able to cover household expenses and support her children through school.
One of her children finished secondary school and the other one is about to do so.
Ana is very grateful for the previous loans.
At the moment, she does not have enough working capital to strengthen her business, so she asks for a new loan to buy an industrial grill.
She will thus be able to make more tortillas and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy an industrial grill to make more food to sell.

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr: Mabengwa est commerçante, vice-présidente de la banque communautaire «Nuru», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 10 enfants dont 8 scolarisés et 2 sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un dépôt du centre commercial depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en six sacs d’haricots. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Mabengwa is a 38 year old woman and food vendor, vice president of the community bank, "Nuru," a client of IMF Hekima, and is the mother of 10 children, 8 of whom are in school and 2 who are still young. She has been selling food at a warehouse in the commercial center for the past 10 years. She will use the loan to buy 6 bags of beans. She started her business using her husband's financial support. She hopes to build her own house, feed and send all of her children to school. She thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs not eligible for bank loans.

loans.use: to buy six bags of beans.

loans.name: Efrain Jose

texts.es:
Efrain José es un estudiante de derecho,El solicita un prestamo para cubrir sus gastos de estudios. esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Efraín, tengo 18 años de edad, nací en Santo Domingo, República Dominicana, que es donde vivo con mis padres y mi hermano menor. Mi padre está sin empleo, por lo que hace trabajos  de manera independiente, mi madre es ama de casa y mi hermano esta está estudiando, ya en el nivel secundario.
Por la razón de que mis padres están desempleados no contamos con los recursos para pagar la carrera que deseo estudiar, la cual es licenciatura en derecho, ya que siempre ha sido mi sueño, ser un abogado exitoso y respetado.
Siempre me ha gustado leer y que las cosas se hagan correctamente… ser justo. Además en un futuro, tener mi propia oficina de abogados y ayudar a los ciudadanos con sus problemas legales.
Mediante este préstamo daría un gran primer paso en la escalera de mis sueños. Por estas razones es que estoy pidiendo un préstamo a través del programa KIVA, quiero cumplir mis sueños y el de mi familia de que sea exitoso en la profesión que elija.
Agradecido de antemano.
texts.en:
Efrain José, a law student, needs a loan to cover higher education costs.
He is 18 and was born in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic, where he lives with his parents and his younger brother.
His father is unemployed and does odd jobs here and there.
His mother is a housewife and his brother attends secondary school.
Since Efrain José's parents are unemployed, he has to find his own way to pay for university.
He chose Law because he always dreamed of becoming a successful and respected lawyer.
He has always liked reading and is passionate about justice and equality.
He hopes he will be able to open his own law office one day and help fellow citizens navigate the law.
This loan would be the first step to achieving his goals.
He asks for a loan through Kiva to make his dream come true so that his family sees him become a successful professional.
He thanks Kiva lenders in advance.

loans.use: to cover higher education costs.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la albañileria desde hace 15 años y es gracias a su trabajo como puede salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, el quiere construir un cuarto adicional pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion y asi poder construir el cuarto para una vivienda mas amplia y comoda.
texts.en: Alfonso is 32 and lives in his own home with his wife and three children. He has been a brick worker for fifteen years, and because of his job he can cover his household expenses. He would like to build an additional room, but he cannot afford it with just his earnings from his job. For that reason he is applying for a loan to buy construction materials and build a larger, more comfortable room.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 29 years old and single with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for one year. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, candies, noodles, bread, milk, sugar, cigarettes and other snack foods.

In the future Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, bread, milk, sugar, cigarettes and other snack foods.

loans.name: St. Bernadette School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fred. He is the deputy head teacher of St. Bernadette Primary School, a mixed school with 1,200 students in the rural area of Nakibizzi in Jinja.

St. Bernadette School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system that will provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent, clean, drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. Bernadette School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Fred ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Alh. Lawal

texts.en:
Alh. Lawal is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. He anticipates a good harvest this season as he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare, which is five and a half times greater than that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Lawal would have had to sell his maize at the time of harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Lawal will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare. Thanks to Babban Gona’s, support he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Alh. Lawal is requesting a loan to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest. He is thankful that he has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. Alh. Lawal looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Muntari

texts.en:
Muntari is maize farmer from Hana Aiki village. As a member of Babban Gona, he is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, Muntari has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare, which is five and a half times greater than that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Muntari would have had to sell his maize at the time of harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare. With Babban Gona’s, support Muntari can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Muntari is requesting a loan to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest. He is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana has been a very good client by repaying on time. Now, she has made a profit margin of about 15% yearly. She has also hired one young boy to sell for her.

For the time being, Christiana would like to diversify a little bit. She would like to introduce some eco-friendly articles such as solar lamps in the business. Moreover, she counts on Zafen to support her with coaching and business training. She has applied for another loan.

loans.use: to buy dozens of solar lamps to sell.

loans.name: Jose Misael

texts.es:
José, tiene 34 años de edad, está acompañado, su pareja tiene 32 años de edad, tienen dos hijos uno de 15 meses de nacido y otro de 6 años de edad, él tiene que trabajar para que en su hogar no falte lo necesario para tener una vida con menos carencias, tiene como fuente de ingresos la siembra de granos básicos y crianza de ganado, actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace 12 años, sus padres le enseñaron el oficio, las cosechas son para alimentar a su familia así como también para comercializarlo entre sus clientes.
Invertirá específicamente en abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla mejorada de granos básicos para sembrar en el tiempo justo y tener una producción mayor, el resto le servirá para pagar el alquiler del terreno, al cubrir de inmediato todos estos gastos las posibilidades de tener un negocio más rentable aumentan.
Las aspiraciones que tiene José son ampliar su negocio y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José, who is 34 years old, is accompanied by his partner, 32 years old, and two children, one 15 months old and a 6 year old. He has to work so that none of the basic needs are missing from his home in order to have a life with fewer shortcomings. His source of income is the sowing of basic grains and cattle raising, an activity that he has been working in for 12 years. His parents taught him the trade. The crops are to feed his family as well as for sale to their customers.

He will invest specifically in fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides and improved seed for basic grain in order to plant at the right time and have a higher production. The rest will serve to pay the rent of the land. By meeting these expenses immediately, the chances of having a profitable business increases.

José's goals are to expand his business and offer a better quality of life to his children.

loans.use: to invest specifically in fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides and improved seed for basic grain in order to plant at the right time and have a greater production.

loans.name: Hongguang

texts.en:
Hongguang is 26 years old, single, and lives with his adoptive mother who is 70 years old without means for living. He was a chef at the hotel before, but later he resigned, and then began to set up a stall. He has rented a retail shop in his community to sell food and general merchandise for almost two years.

Hongguang’s life is very unfortunate. When he was a child, his right eye became blind. His birth parents abandoned him, and his adoptive mother took him in and raised him. Fortunately, his adoptive mother treats him well.

He is busy in his daily life. In addition to taking care of his mother, he needs to manage operation of the stall. He requested ￥20,000 from MicroCred, and this is the second loan. For the first loan, he has stocked many goods and enriched his stall, which meets the demands of his customers. For the second loan, Hongguang wants to expand his shop.

loans.use: to expand his shop

loans.name: Ahacu Heza Hazaza Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 44 years old and married, and they have two children who are between four and ten years of age. He is well-known in his business, which he has been doing for about five years. Emmanuel is the president of the Ahacu Heza Hazaza Group, which means, in both the local language and English, "to have a bright future"; he is the one who has his hand raised.

Emmanuel's hours of selling in the general store are from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day. He wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase various goods to sell such as sugar, salt, bread, rice, etc.

With the profit from this loan, Emmanuel will be able to purchase enough food for the family, buy new clothes for the children, pay school fees for his children, buy medical insurance for his family, and expand his business by buying more and various items such as clothes, Irish potatoes, and bananas.

loans.use: to purchase various goods to sell such as sugar, salt, bread, rice, etc.

loans.name: Malam Hussaini

texts.en:
Malam Hussaini is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty which will help renew his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Before joining Babban Gona, Malam Hussaini would have had to sell his maize at the time of harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare. With Babban Gona’s, support Muntari can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Malam Hussaini is requesting a loan to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest. He is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to increase his farmland. Malam Hussaini looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Serious Women Group

texts.en:
Jalikatu is a 40-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of the Serious Women solidarity group. The Serious Women solidarity group has four members. (See the group picture, in which Jalikatu stands on the second right).

Nine years ago, Jalikatu established her used bags business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food for her children. She opens her business six days in a week from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The Serious Women group needs a total loan of 18,000,000 SLL. Jalikatu is entitled to 4,500,000 SLL, which she will use to buy four bales of used bags for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Jalikatu is married with five children, ages 17, 14, 12, 10 and 2 years; all are school-going children.

In the future, Jalikatu plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Jelikatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy four bales of used bags for her business.

loans.name: Ainee

texts.en:
Ainee works hard to support her family. She is single with two children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

Ainee requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Ainee would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is now 44 years old. She is looking for her second loan from Kiva, through Kubo. She made great profit out of the last one, and she is now looking for 16,000 MXN that will allow her to cover the expenses of her business.

Soon she may accomplish her dream of getting a third tamale stand. She will also be looking to pay some expenses of her daughter's career. Seeing her daughter getting a career degree is Leticia's biggest dream.

loans.use: to buy materials to make and sell tamales (Mexican cornbread).

loans.name: Santiago Uberto

texts.es: Santiago es un hombre trabajador de 55 años que vive junto a su pareja Antonia en la localidad rural de Puquina, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Él trabaja como obrero agrícola y también se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva; Antonia lo ayuda en el cuidado del ganado y en la venta de la leche. Santiago solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar tres vacas orgánicas, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico. Santiago no quiso tomarse la fotografía, pero Antonia sí y es quien aparece en la fotografía.
texts.en:
Santiago is a hardworking 55-year-old man who lives with his partner, Antonia, in the rural town of Puquina, which is located in Moquegua. He works as a farm laborer and also makes a living in agriculture and by raising organic cattle, always paying great attention to the care and the food he provides them which consists of the organic alfalfa he grows. Antonia helps with the care of the cattle and with the sale of their milk.

Santiago solicits a micro-loan so that he can buy three organic cows. He hopes to sell their milk at a better price since it is organic. In the future he hopes to be able to improve his family's living conditions and to continue having good health, a reason for which he bets on organic.

Santiago did not want to have his photo taken, but Antonia did and this is who appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy three organic cows in order to sell the milk they produce and thus increase his income.

loans.name: Dones Alexis

texts.es:
El  joven Dones Alexis de 27 años de edad es casado y vive con su esposa y su hija en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 06 años al comercio, vende de abarrotería y también hamacas y combustible vende todos los días desde la mañana hasta por la noche el atiende a sus clientes que son todos sus amigos, vecinos y personas que se transitan por su negocio. 
Dones Alexis es un hombre emprendedor que lucha día con día junto a su esposa para hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar varias hamacas de seda para atender a sus clientes con más variedad, también ha estado haciendo algunas ampliaciones en su casa y necesita comprar algunos materiales como cemento, arena y arenilla para terminar los repellos, con este crédito espera mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos y obtener mejores ganancias, es un cliente  con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa para mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Dones Alexis, 27 years old, is married and lives with his wife and daughter in their own home. He's been working in sales since 2006 years. He sells from his grocery store and also sells hammocks and fuel. He sells every day from morning until evening serving his customers, who are all his friends, neighbors and people passing by his business.

Dones Alexis is an entrepreneur who works hard every day with his wife in order to grow his business and improve their quality of life. His is requesting the loan in order to purchase several silk hammocks to serve his customers with more variety. He has also been doing some extensions at home and need to buy some materials, including cement, sand and gravel to finish the plastering. With this loan he expects to improve his sales and revenues and enjoy better profits. He wishes to continue working with Prisma.

His dream is to finish building their house to improve the quality of life together with his family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2015.

loans.use: to purchase hammocks, cement, sand and gravel for his home and business.

loans.name: Government Whart Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is 30 years old and married with a cheerful family of two children. Her children are ages two and five, and both go to school. For the past two years, Fatmata has sold drinks and she uses the proceeds of her business to pay for her children’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family. Fatmata is a member of a Government Whart solidarity group, consisting of four women and one man, who have come together to support each other to achieve their individual dreams. She is shown is sitting in the middle of the group picture.

Fatmata and her group members are requesting a 7,500,000 SLL loan. She will use her 1,500,000 SLL portion of the loan to buy 50 crates of drinks to resell. Fatmata hopes that her business will continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a house and prepare for her old age. She hopes that her loan will increase her profits so she can support her family. Fatmata and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase crates of drinks for her business

loans.name: Elido

texts.en:
Elido has been in business for the past 10 years. He is originally from the Dominican Republic and is the proud owner of ET Collision Specialists, an auto body and auto repair shop that offers high quality repairs and excellent customer service to the New Brunswick community.

Elido learned about cars at a very young age from his father in the Dominican Republic. He started his business helping a few neighbors and friends repair their vehicles on side of his full-time job. He saw how much his honest advice mattered to his first customers and decided to start his own business to help others get quality, honest service. His biggest challenge came during the financial crisis, when business slowed down. Because of his repeat customers, who value Elido's work, his business was able to remain open, and now he is ready to invest in expansion. He is applying for a loan to purchase new equipment to update his brake system evaluation and offer customers an improved service.
