Асалбек хочет, чтобы его сын хорошо учился и стать хорошим образованным человеком. Его дочка закончила школу. Дочка выходится замуж. Асалбек активно готовиться к свадьбе дочке. Ему не хватает денег для приобретения свадебные принадлежности. И по той причине Асалбек просит кредит. Асалбек хочет успешно проводить свадьбу. Поддержите его!
texts.en:
Asalbek is a resident of the Yavan region. He is 50 years old. He is married and the father of two children. He has one daughter and one son. Asalbek was born and grew up in an educated family. He is a well educated man.

Asalbek works as an electrician. He does electricity work really well. He has worked as an electrician for 24 years. His son goes to high school Asalbek would like his son to study well and become a well educated man.

Asalbek's daughter has finished high school. She is getting married. Asalbek is actively preparing for his daughter's wedding. He does not have enough money to purchase wedding accessories. For this reason he requests a loan. Asalbek would like to hold a successful wedding. Please support him!

loans.use: to purchase wedding accessories

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es: Gloria de 46 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, desde hace mas de 3 años ejerce este oficio y cuenta con muchos clientes fijos con lo que puede mantener su negocio a flote, adicional a eso tambien vende productos de uso personal, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar y esta solicitando un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa interior diferentes precios, estilos y colores y de esta forma contar con más clientes y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Gloria is 46 and she sells men's and women's underwear.  She has had this business for over three years and she has many steady customers who keep her business afloat.  In addition to this she also sells personal care products.  With profits from her sales she is able to cover some of her household expenses.  She lives in her own home with her family group and she is requesting this loan to buy a larger quantity of underwear in different prices, styles and colors.  This will bring in more customers and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of underwear in different prices, styles, and colors.

loans.name: Diana Marie

texts.en:
Diana Marie is 33 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Diana Marie works very hard to provide for them.

Diana Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, breads, snack foods and personal care products. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Diana Marie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, bread, eggs, breads, snack foods and personal care products.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children. She is 40 years old and all three of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Josephine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Josephine requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Leonisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Leonisa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Leonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 28 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school. Cristine works very hard to provide for them.

Cristine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, breads, milk, sugar, cigarettes and snack foods. Cristine has been in this business for one year.

In the future Cristine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, breads, milk, sugar, cigarettes and snack foods.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia, 40, is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Olivia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like thread, cloth, needle, scissors and other materials for her business.

Olivia has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread, cloth, needles, scissors and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Choy

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kampong Thom province, Choy is 42 years old. He is the father of four children, three of whom are still in school. The primary source of his income is from growing rice, which he has been involved in for 22 years. He earns additional income by working for others for a fee and catching fish. For some years, his crop has been destroyed by floods; he couldn’t get high yields.

This is Choy's first time with VisionFund. He is going to use this loan to pay for school fees for his son. He hopes to get high yields to earn more income so that he has enough ability to keep his children in school. He hopes to see his son have a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To pay for school fees for his son.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Roxana Patricia

texts.es:
Roxana, es una persona soltera, no tiene hijos, su única responsabilidad es suplir las necesidades de sus padres, ella es propietaria de un comedor que lo tiene ubicado en una zona muy buena para las ventas, además tiene otros ingresos por el alquiler de un parqueo. Es así como puede salir adelante con su familia.
Con la llegada de las fiestas patronales de la ciudad en que vive y otras fechas importantes de fin de año, ella requiere de un crédito para comprar variedad de bebidas al mayoreo, también invertirá en equipo de trabajo como: picheles y licuadoras, de esta manera tendrá un negocio más competitivo y con más producto almacenado para tener clientes satisfechos.
Roxana sueña con un día lograr darles una vida más confortable a sus padres así como también para ella.
texts.en:
Roxana is single and has no children. Her only responsibility is to provide for the needs of her parents. She is the owner of a food stall that is located in a very good area for sales and she also has other income from renting parking. In this way she can get ahead with her family.

With the coming of her city's saint days and other important dates at the end of the year she needs a loan to buy a variety of drinks wholesale and also invest in equipment for work like pitchers and blenders. In this way she will have a more competitive business and have more product stored to satisfy her clients.

Roxana dreams of one day managing to provide a more comfortable life for her parents and also for herself.

loans.use: to buy a variety of drinks wholesale and also invest in equipment for work like pitchers and blenders, in this way she will have a more competitive business.

loans.name: Avzalmoh

texts.ru:
Авзалмох молодая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 30 лет. Она мать троих детей. Она воспитывает их одна. Она живет в городской местности. Авзалмох торгует на рынке фруктами. Ей нравится ее работа так как приносит хорошую прибыль. 
 Авзалмох хочет провести мероприятие по обрезанию свое сына. Но у неё не хватает собственных средств. Она обратилась в МДО Арванд за кредитом.  
Авзалмох заранее благодарит МДО «Арванд» за предоставленную помощь и надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Avzalmoh is a young and hardworking woman. She is 30 years old and the mother of three children. She is raising them by herself. Avzalmoh lives in a urban area. She sells fruit at the market. She likes her work as it brings in a good income.

Avzalmoh would like to hold a circumcision ceremony for her son, but she does not have enough money. She turned to "MDO Arvand" for a loan. Avzalmoh thanks "MDO Arvand" in advance for the help provided and hopes for further cooperation.

loans.use: to hold a circumcision event for her son

loans.name: Santos Sebastiana

texts.es: Santos, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo y vive junto a ellos en una aldea del Municipio de Gracias Lempira. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, cremas, champú, lociones etc. y hace 4 años inicio con el negocio de pulpería donde vende maíz, frijoles, arroz, manteca, jabón, café, refrescos, y otros abarrotes de primera necesidad. Ha decidido invertir un préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras para comprar más productos y surtir como ser refrescos, galletas, churros, pan, azúcar y productos de aseo. Su propósito es mantener siempre su negocio y reinvertir las ganancias para hacerlo crecer. Tiene como meta ampliar el local y vender otros productos que le ayuden a incrementar las ventas.
texts.en: Santos is 38 years old; she is a single mother who has two children under her care and she lives with them in a neighborhood of the municipality of Gracias Lempira.  She used to sell cosmetics, creams, shampoo, lotions, etc. and four years ago she started a grocery business where she sells corn, beans, rice, lard, soap, coffee, soft drinks, and other essential grocery items.  She has decided to invest a loan of 6,000 lempiras in buying more products to stock up on things such as soft drinks, cookies, churros, bread, sugar, and personal care products.  Her plan is to keep her business going and reinvest her profits to make it grow.  Her goal is to expand her store and sell other products that will help her increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more products and stock up with soft drinks, cookies, churros, bread, sugar, and personal care products.

loans.name: Afsheen

texts.en:
Afsheen, 31 years old, resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. Afsheen has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years; she also contributes her income, along with her husband's, to manage the household.

Afsheen needs to buy different types of cosmetics, creams, hairbrushes and other accessories for her beauty salon but, due to financial constraints, is not capable of buying these items. Therefore, Afsheen has applied for a Kiva loan to help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family. Afsheen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase inventory for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Enrique Epifenio

texts.es: Don Enrique de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace 19 años y lo comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ganado para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingesos economicos.
texts.en:
Don Enrique is 64 years old and lives in his own dwelling with his wife and two children.
He has been raising cattle for 19 years and he markets them in nearby villages. With the money obtained by sales he manages to cover some of the expenses of his household.
He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle, so as to continue with his work and have better income.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to continue with his work.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years old and married with three children, two of whom are presently in school. Rose works very hard to provide for them.

Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, eggs and other snack foods.

Rose has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Rose would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items of groceries to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana requiere de un nuevo crédito para poder surtir su negocio, en esta oportunidad comprara flores naturales para vender en la temporada de enflorar difuntos, ella normalmente vende frutas y verduras pero con este nuevo producto tendrá oportunidad de tener ingresos extras y de atender a otro tipo de cliente.
El crédito anterior ha sido de mucha utilidad para mantener su fuente de ingresos en el mercado, tienes más clientes satisfechos y sus ingresos han incrementado, en cuanto a su familia sigue conservándose igual pero con un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Ana requires a new loan to be able to stock her business. At this time she will buy natural flowers to sell for the season of offering flowers to the dead. She normally sells fruits and vegetables but with this new product she will have the opportunity to have extra income and serve another type of client.

Her previous loan was very useful in maintaining her source of income in the market. She has more satisfied clients and her earnings have increased. Her family remains the same but with a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy natural flowers to sell for the season of offering flowers to the dead. She normally sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 51 год, замужем, есть сын. У нее средне образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 15 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 30,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Гулмиры есть 5 коров, 5 овец. На участке мерою 2,10 Га собственной земли она выращивает картофель и пшеницу. Вся экологически чистая продукция Гулмиры пользуется большим спросом и приносит хорошую прибыль в размере около 7,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 8 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 51 years old, married and has a son. She has secondary education. As a main income for her family, she has worked with agriculture for 15 years, after having started this business with 30,000 som (KGS). Gulmira has five cows and five sheep on her farm. She grows potatoes and wheat on her own plot of land of 2.10 hectares. Gulmira's products are all ecological, in high demand and bring in a good income of around 7,500 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulmira turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 45,000 som (KGS) to purchase eight sheep for breeding and selling. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business and in building a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina, 33 years old, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the family's needs. Robina provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute, with her husband, to managing the household.

Robina needs different kinds of goods, such as needles, thread, cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business but, due to insufficient financial means, is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable Robina to purchase these accessories and help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase accessories to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gelacio

texts.en:
Gelacio is an artisan from Peru who specializes in reverse painted glass mirrors and home decor. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood, glass, paint and lacquer.

Gelacio has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I showed talent for the arts while still in school, and began to sell my woodwork and painted glass through an artisan cooperative. In 1997, I formed an association of craftspeople dedicated to Peruvian arts, and work with my three brothers in our own workshop. I feel very content that my work is appreciated in people's homes, and I share this happiness with my family."

"I will use this microcredit to build up my inventory prior to the holiday season. Gracias!"

Use the link below to view Gelacio's reverse painted glass mirrors and home decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4004

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood, glass, paint and lacquer for his designs

loans.name: Somluck

texts.en:
Somluck is an artisan from Thailand who specializes in cultured pearl and gemstone jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones for her designs.

Somluck has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is her story:

"I was born in December 1964, the youngest of five children. My parents used to have a jewelry shop on the Myanmar border, but then we moved to a different city, where I went to high school. Now my two older brothers have jewelry shops and I began by helping them, which allowed me to learn a lot. Now I design and craft pieces myself. I start by imagining a design, sketching it and selecting the materials. I use only high quality materials from Thailand."

"Thank you in advance for helping to fund the loan. It will allow me to increase my inventory and create new product lines."

Use the link below to view Somluck's cultured pearl and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/4746

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones for her designs

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es: La Señora María Estela es casada y tiene 53 años de edad. Tiene 3 hijos de 36, 30 y 15 años. El último de sus hijos está estudiando. El préstamo ayudará al mejoramiento de su parcela de tara y en el incremento de la canasta familiar; dentro de los sueños y esperanzas de doña María Estela está brindar una buena educación a su último hijo. Con 15 años en el cultivo y negocio de la tara, lo que más le gusta es que no necesita de productos químicos para tener buena producción y porque ayuda económicamente a la familia
texts.en:
María Estela is married and she is 53 years old. She has 3 children aged 36, 30 and 15. Her youngest child is studying. The loan will help to improve her tara tree land plot and to increase the family shopping basket. Among María Estela's dreams and hopes is to offer a good education to her last child.

What she likes the most, after 15 years of tara cultivation and trading, is that it does not require chemical products to have a good yield and because it helps economically to the family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertiliser to improve her tara tree land plot.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mara es de la ciudad de Asunción,  trabaja de medio tiempo en una Empresa Privada y por la noche va a la universidad en la carrera de administración de empresas, una vez culminada la carrera pretende trabajar como su padre como administradora del negocio familia.
Mara es una persona que se dedica mucho a sus estudios y pone todo de sí para salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de libros y pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mara is from the city of Asunción. She works part time in a private enterprise and by night goes to university to study business administration. Once she finishes, she intends to work like her father as administrator of the family business.

Mara is very dedicated to her studies and gives it her all to succeed.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of books and to pay her fees.

loans.use: to pay fees and buy books

loans.name: Shenna

texts.en:
Shenna, 29, is married with three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Shenna is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

Shenna has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Shenna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lidia Margarita

texts.es:
Lidia, de 54 años de edad, solo estudio educación básica, está casada, su esposo trabaja realizando viajes a personas particulares o transportando materiales, juntos tienen 4 hijos pero solo dos de sus hijos se encuentran realizando sus estudios superiores, su hija estudia medicina y su hijo estudia marketing internacional y sus otros dos hijos se encuentran laborando.

Lidia, inició una venta de carne en la casa, pero luego construyeron un local hecho de palmas de coco para ampliar su negocio, ahora vende almuerzos y hace comida para eventos especiales, ella se levanta muy temprano para iniciar con los oficios de la casa y luego junto a su hija preparan todo lo necesario para el negocio.- Ella vende almuerzo hasta las 2:00 de la tarde y desde las 3:00 p.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. vende hot-dogs.

Lidia, necesita el préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas para el negocio, de esta manera pretende mejorar la atención a sus clientes y darle otro aspecto al negocio.

Lidia, sueña con que su pequeña venta de almuerzos, se convierta en un restaurante y tener instalaciones más cómodas.
texts.en:
Lidia, who is 54 years old, only had a basic education. She is married and her husband works giving rides to individuals or transporting materials. Together they have four children but only two of their children are completing higher education. Her daughter is studying medicine and her son is studying international marketing. Their other two children are working.

Lidia started a meat-selling business in the house, but later built a place made of coconut palms to expand her business. Now she sells lunches and makes food for special events. She wakes up very early to begin the household chores and later, with her daughter, prepares all that is necessary for the business. She sells lunch until 2:00 in the afternoon and from 3:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. sells hot dogs. 

Lidia needs the loan to buy tables and chairs for the business. In this way she intends to improve service for her customers and bring another aspect to the business.

Lidia dreams that her small lunch business may become a restaurant and have more comfortable facilities.

loans.use: to buy tables and seats for the business

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 31 лет. Он женат и имеет 3-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Хусейн живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. У него высшее образование. Он работает специалистом в дорожной компании.  Жена Хусейна не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. Чтобы иметь дополнительный доход на пропитание, Хусейн занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Хусейну в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Хусейн хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Хусейн очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Huseyn is a lively and hardworking man of the age of 31. He is married and has three children. He turned to "Arvand" for the first time when he learned that it was possible to get financial support. Huseyn lives together with his family in a rural village. He has higher education. He works as a specialist in a road construction company. Huseyn's wife does not have an education and is a housewife. She does the household work and looks after the children.

In order to have an additional income, Huseyn has his own business. He works with breeding and selling cattle. He gets a good income from this business. His wife also helps him with it; she sells milk from the cattle. Currently Huseyn would like to increase the number of cattle to expand his business. He turned to "Arvand" and would like to get a loan to purchase cattle. He hopes very much for a positive result and thanks "Arvand" in advance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru:
Мадина добрая  и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 42 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Мадина мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Мадину выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Мадина никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Мадина вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Мадина выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Мадина получает хороший доход. Муж Мадины также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Мадина с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Мадина заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Madina is a good and hardworking woman. She is 42 years old. She is married and has five children. She lives in a small rural village. Since her childhood, Madina dreamed of becoming a teacher, however the circumstances were such that she was not able to get higher education due to her family's insufficient financials.

Soon after finishing high school, Madina got married. This way she became a housewife. However, ever if she stays at home, she never sits idle. Together with her husband she strives to do everything possible to provide their children with all necessities. To have a stable income for food, Madina and her husband started their own business. They work with livestock breeding.

Madina breeds livestock and then sells the meat and milk. She gets a good income from this business. Madina's husband also works as a local builder, and his work brings in an additional income for the family. Their combined income is enough for middle class living. However, they still don't have enough money to cover all the family's needs.

Currently, Madina and her husband would like to purchase additional livestock for breeding. Due to this, Madina turned to "Arvand" to take a loan to purchase livestock. Madina thanks "Arvand" in advance for the support, which will improve the family's life quality.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia lives in Liquica and most of her daily income comes from selling chickens. She is now applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

Herminia started her business a few years ago with her own working capital. She will use this loan to add to her principal amount to buy more chickens. When she finishes selling her chickens, Herminia will go to another place to buy more chickens, after which she will bring them back to resell in the market. She is happy with the loan that was offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her business because it can support her to keep up her spirits.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema, a responsible mother of five children, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the past ten years, her eldest son has been providing transport services by driving a Suzuki. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Haleema's son needs to perform maintenance on his Suzuki because its current condition is not good and it requires maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, Haleema's son is unable to carry out this maintenance. Therefore, Haleema has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Haleema's son can easily afford the maintenance costs and provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Haleema also plans to make savings with the profit from her son's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Haleema is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help pay for the maintenance costs for her son's Suzuki.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, 39, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the family's needs.

Parveen provides sewing services to earn income to contribute to managing the household with her husband. She needs goods for her business, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth and machine oil. Due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these supplies. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will enable her to purchase the supplies she needs, provide better sewing services and increase her monthly sales and profits. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring services.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 30 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 5 years. Her husband is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family.

Sonia's husband wants to purchase different kinds of additional commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumable items for his business. Due to financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of these products for reselling purposes. Therefore Sonia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities. It will also be helpful for him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.

Sonia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more commodities for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Aizirek

texts.en:
Aizirek is a 19-year-old freshman in the sociology program at American University of Central Asia (AUCA). She is from the south part of Kyrgyzstan, which is the biggest and hottest region in the country. Its people raise cattle, grow fruits and vegetables, and do sales in bazaars, but the majority of people are unemployed.

Aizirek’s family is not an exception. She has a big family of nine: parents, two elder brothers, elder sister, herself, two younger brothers and a younger sister. Her elder brother and elder sister are married and live separately. Her parents are unemployed: her mother has to do household work and her father is a veteran of the Afghan war. For this reason, her father gets a small amount of compensation from the state. The family has had hard times. It was so difficult to feed the members that the second elder brother went to the neighboring country of Kazakhstan to work as a migrant. So the main source of income for this family is the money sent by the brother in Kazakhstan. Aizirek says that time is passing and her younger siblings are going to school, which means additional expenses.

As with thousands of people, Aizirek dreamed to study at the best university which is accredited at an international level. When she learnt about AUCA, she was upset about the tuition as she considered it unrealistic for her family. By applying for financial aid and a Kiva loan, she hopes to realize her goals. Her family is doing its best in order to give a chance to Aizirek to continue her studies. This Kiva loan is very appreciated by her, and she is waiting for the earliest fundraising.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education at the American University of Central Asia (AUCA).

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DELOS MILAGROS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Izcuchaca , perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La señora valentina es una persona luchadora y emprendedora, ella se dedica a al negocio de venta de ropa, con esos sustenta su hogar.
La socia tiene 44 años y 4 hijos con los que sale adelante para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar polos y pantalones, ya que se acerca fiestas de fin de año, y el negocio de ropa es muy solicitado.

Los otros socios se dedican al  negocio de venta de comida, brindar servicios de limpieza, servicios de docencia y negocios de agricultura.
las personas en la fotografía grupal que están tapados sus rostros no pertenecen al banco comunal

La socia está muy agradecida y contenta con el crédito ya que le ayudara mucho en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “SEÑOR DELOS MILAGROS” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Izcuchaca, which belongs to the province of Anta and Cusco department.

Valentina is a fighter and enterprising person. She works in the business of selling clothing and she supports her household doing this.

She is 44 years old and has four children she is raising so they have a better quality of living.

She is requesting a loan to buy shirts and pants as the festivities of the end of the year are approaching and the clothing business is much in demand.

The other members work in a food selling business, provide cleaning services, teach and have agriculture businesses.

The people in the photo with their faces covered do not belong to the communal bank.

Valentina is very grateful and happy with the loan as it will help her greatly in her business.

loans.use: to buy shirts and pants.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es madre soltera vive con sus padres  y les ayuda en el negocio, ella está cursando el cuarto  año de la carrera Trabajo social. Sus metas futuras son la de trabajar en su profesión  obtener mejores   ingresos para  darle una mejor educación a su hija seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a single mother. She lives with her parents and she helps them with their business. She is in her fourth year of studying social work. Her future goals are to work in her profession and obtain better income to give her daughter a better education and to keep helping her family.

She requests this loan to be able to pay her school fees, and in this way be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past three years, Elizabeth has operated a business selling fruits and bananas. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

Elizabeth wants to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of fruits and bananas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Nuevo Portal De Belén (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Nuevo Portal De Belén. Este grupo está formado por 8 mujeres y 2 hombres que esperan con la ayuda de los créditos ir mejorando su vida, ellos se dedican a diversas actividades con la finalidad de ser útiles a la sociedad y a sus familias que son lo más importante para ellos. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Sandra, tiene 43 años de edad y está divorciada, ella vive en casa de una hermana con sus sobrinos que son su adoración.
Doña Sandra es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo para salir adelante sola y así no depender de nadie, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa,  deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas, tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le compran ya que les da buenos descuentos y la mejor atención, lleva 5 años con esta actividad la cual le ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y espera seguir por mucho tiempo contando con la ayuda de estos créditos que son muy buenos para ella y sus compañeros. Sus sueños son tener un buen local.
texts.en:
The community bank Nuevo Portal De Belén meets together every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo. This group is made up of 8 women and two men who hope to improve their lives with the help of loans. They work in various activities with the purpose of being useful to society and to their families, which are most important to them.
One of the members of the group is Sandra, who is 43 years old and divorced. She lives in the home of a sister with her nieces and nephews whom she adores.
Doña Sandra is a woman who has always liked to support herself and get by alone and not have to depend on anyone. That's why she works in commerce--she sells clothing of all types. Her manner of sales is door to door and she also sells from her home. She sells on credit and collects weekly. She has a good clientele that buy from her because she offers good discounts and the best service. She's been selling clothes for 5 years and that's what helps her get by. 
This is her first loan cycle with the community bank and she hopes to continue counting on these loans for a long time to come because the loans are good for her and her fellow members. Her dream is to have a good shop.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is married and has three children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family. For the past two years, Penina has operated a business selling fruits and bananas. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

Penina wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of fruits and bananas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 27 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование средне-специальное. На протяжении 10 лет она занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 8 коров и 35 овец. Ежемесячный доход Гулмиры на сегодняшний день доходит до 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 27 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has vocational eduation. For a period of ten years she has worked with livestock breeding. Currently she has eight cows and 35 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is up to 22,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulmira turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she sells handbags and shoes. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (women's wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Rasmita's Group

texts.en:
Rasmita, standing on the left-hand side in the photograph, is a divorcee. She hails from the small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She lives with her parents in her parents' house and is engaged in sugarcane cultivation and raising her two minor children. Rasmita has also been cultivating vegetables for the last two years.

Along with her group member, Rasmita has requested a loan of 30,000 Indian rupees. Rasmita will use her portion of the loan to pay for farm labour costs, application and incorporation of plant treatment. This will help improve her crop physiologically, morphologically and productively. It will also allow her to have an opportune harvest and greater production. The product will be of better quality so she will not have any problem selling it. This will give her more income for a better quality of life and to provide education to her children. She has a plan to purchase a power tiller, which will facilitate her farming business in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for farm labour costs, application and incorporation of plant treatment.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita has been involved in her business activities for a few years, having started her business with her own working capital of $600. Leonita is married and her husband, who works in agriculture, is very supportive of her doing business. Leonita has a kiosk in her house, where many people come to buy her products.

Leonita is requesting a loan of $1,500 because she wants to buy more items that people like, such as candies, biscuits, sugar, cigarettes, gambling cards, noodles, milk, soft drinks and other items. She is very hopeful that, with this loan, she can improve the management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy candies, biscuits, sugar, cigarettes, gambling cards, noodles, milk, soft drinks and other items to sell.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan, 55, is a responsible mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her elder son has been running his own bike shop for the past seven years. He needs to purchase tools, chairs, spare parts and other accessories for his business.

Due to insufficient financial means, Majeedan's son is unable to purchase this merchandise. To fulfill her son's business needs, Majeedan has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, she will help her son to buy merchandise for his business. This will help him earn more income, and the income will support him in fulfilling his family's needs.

Majeedan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for her son's bike shop.

loans.name: Sanju's Group

texts.en:
Sanju, standing on the right-hand side in the photograph, is a single mother. She hails from the small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She lives with her three children and takes utmost care of them. Her elder son works as a carpenter in a local shop. Sanju has undergone a lot of hardships after her husband left her and she found it difficult to meet the basic requirements of the family. For this reason, she took the initiative to start a poultry business.

Along with her group member, Sanju has requested a loan of 30,000 Indian rupees to purchase feeds and fodders, vaccines and medicines for the chicks. This will enable Sanju to increase the volume of sales resulting in a rise in her income.

Sanju aspires to build a large poultry house for the breeding of chickens with the money that she will generate from her poultry business. She will use a certain part of her income in educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and fodders, vaccines and medicines for the chicks.

loans.name: Casilda Magdalena

texts.en:
Casilda makes a living by selling shoes through a catalog. She does a very good job selling to friends and neighbors and has made a good business of it.

Ever since she turned 25, when her parents granted her a piece of land, she started saving to build her house. Piece by piece, she has managed to build a structure she feels proud of. Still, after ten years she has not been able to move in, since the floor is still dirt and the walls are not covered. Winters would be very harsh under current conditions, and with the rainy season, the flooded and damp floor will be a health hazard, especially given her chronic illness.

Casilda is excited to finally finish her house; she cannot see the day when she can finally move in. This credit will give her the money she needs to install a floor and finish the walls. She says that without this credit, it will take at least another five years to complete the necessary work to move in. Given that her job is informal and she has no constant income, no other institution will give her credit. With this credit, she will receive visits and supervision from certified technicians who will ensure that the construction meets all the safety and quality standards.

Casilda is thankful for this opportunity and is now planning on the next steps for future credits.

loans.use: to cover the dirt floor of her house with a proper floor, finish the walls, and after years of building, finally move in.

loans.name: Galdys

texts.es:
Gladys es estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, está cursando su segundo año, trabaja en una Junta de Saneamiento, para poder tener los medios para así colaborar en su hogar.
Ella desea ser una profesional útil, no solo a sí misma, sino también a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de la matrícula de su carrera.
texts.en:
Gladys is a student majoring in law. She is in her second year, working in Sanitation in order to have the means to contribute to her home. She wants to be a useful professional, not only for herself, but also to society. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in the tuition for her degree.

loans.use: to pay college tuition

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian es una persona que se esfuerza mucho por poder ser una buena profesional en la psicología, y por medio de sus estudios poder ayudar a su familia, comenta que su anterior préstamo le fue muy útil para poder seguir estudiando y de esa manera poder cumplir sus anhelos.
Pide este préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Mirian is a person who tries hard to be a good professional in psychology, and through her studies to be able to help her family. She said her previous loan was very useful to be able to continue studying and thus to fulfill her desires.

She requests this loan to be able to pay the fees for her degree.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Catherine has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Her major business challenge is creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit.

Catherine is requesting a loan to purchase stock of Omo, cooking oil, maize flour, sugar and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of Omo (detergent), cooking oil, maize flour, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Kiseeta United Group

texts.en:
Florence is age 60 and a mother of six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She deals in general merchandise at the retail level of day-to-day consumables like salt, sugar, soap flour, rice and other items. She ventured into this business in order to support her family. Her business dream is to expand her business into a bigger shop despite the challenge of bad debtors and price fluctuations due to the economic instability.

Under the group guarantorship, Florence has asked for a loan to buy more stock for the business like sugar, cooking oil, salt and others to sell. She is a member of Kiseeta United Group where members guarantee each other for a loan as they don't pledge security

loans.use: to buy more stock for the business like sugar, cooking oil, salt and other items to sell.

loans.name: Santilata's Group

texts.en:
The lady standing on the right hand side in the photograph is Santilata who lives with her six children in a small village in Odagaon, Odisha, India. She has two sons who are 22 and 18 years old and four daughters who are 20, 19, 16 and 14 years, respectively. Five years ago, her husband passed away in an accident. That was a very hard time for her because the entire family burden fell on her. She is a good mother and is enterprising, sincere, intelligent, generous, understanding, patient, responsible and hardworking. Despite the bad times, she was able to overcome all the hurdles and proved her efficiency by becoming financially independent.

Santilata is engaged in cultivating paddy and wheat and earns a pretty good amount of money after selling the harvest in the market.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Santilata will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a high yielding variety of seeds, insecticides, organic manure and other farm equipment in order to increase the yield per hectare and earn a higher amount of money after selling the harvest in the market. She can reinvest her profit in her farming business and purchase land where she can cultivate different varieties of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a high yielding variety of seeds, insecticides, organic manure and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Kafetha

texts.en:
Kafetha is married and has two school-going children. The family lives in their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Kafetha's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kafetha has operated a business selling khangas (a traditional African women's wrap cloth) from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is lack of capital to expand her business.

Kafetha is requesting a loan to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Shalety

texts.en:
Shalety is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

Shalety has operated a business renting houses to neighbors and people living in a nearby town. She faces the challenge of seasonality in her business. With this loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase cement, sand and paint to repair her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost and and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase  cement, sand and paint to repair her rental houses.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Silvia operates a grocery vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru:
Дилфуза молодая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 32 лет. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. У неё высшее образование. Она работает главным специалистом в финансовом отделе Хукумата. Она очень  хорошая, добрая  и к своей  семье  любящая женщина.  Она очень стремительный и трудолюбивый человек,  зарабатывает на жизнь  своим трудом.  Её муж работает шоферем.  Для дополнительного дохода он также занимается животноводством. 
Наступает зима. А с ними и холода. Дилфуза хотела бы установить пластиковые окна и двери дома. Но у неё не хватает собственных средств. Она обратилась в МДО Арванд за кредитом. Она заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilfuza is a young and hardworking woman. She is 32 years old, married and has two children. She has higher education. She works as a principal specialist at the financial department of the regional government. She is very good and kind and a loving woman to her family. She is a very impetuous and hardworking person, who earns a living through her work. Her husband works as a driver. As an additional income, he also works with livestock breeding.

The winter is coming and due to this, also the cold weather. Dilfuza would like to install plastic windows and doors for her home. However, she does not have enough money. She turned to "MDO Arvand" for a loan. She is thankful in advance for the support.

loans.use: to install plastic doors and windows.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

Zawadi operates a vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en:
Rubi, 34, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her six children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the family's needs. But Rubi provides sewing services to earn income to contribute to managing the household with her husband.

Rubi needs different goods for her business, e.g. needles, thread, pieces of cloth and machine oil. Due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these supplies. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will enable Rubi to purchase the supplies she needs, provide better sewing services and increase her monthly sales and profits. Rubi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring services.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 36-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Samina and her husband have been doing his own business of livestock for the past 21 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Samina and her husband want to purchase buffalo for business purposes, but due to financial constraints, are unable to purchase these cattle. Therefore, Samina has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband and her to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of the business. This will also be good for him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Samina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's livestock business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, es estudiante de Economía, su anhelo es poder enseñar y a la vez tener su propia empresa a la par de su profesión.  
Está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder cumplir sus metas y ser de ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Andrea is from the city of Coronel Oviedo, is married, has two children, and is an economics student. Her dream is to be able to teach and at the same time have her own business in line with her profession.

She is trying her best to be able to reach her goals and be of help to her family.

She requests this loan to be able to pay the fees for her degree.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia actualmente está trabajando y estudiando la carrera de Contaduría Pública.
Su meta es recibirse para poder ser una buena  profesional y así mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, y pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lucia is currently working and studying Public Accounting. Her goal is to be received as a good professional and thus improve her quality of life and that of her family. 

She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving, and asks for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Saroeurng

texts.en:
Saroeurng is a 19-year-old single motorcycle taxi driver who lives in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. He has run a motorcycle taxi service for one year. Saroeurng can make approximately USD 15 per day.

Saroeurng thinks that his motorcycle has a small space for his clients, so he would like to get a loan to buy a Tuk Tuk (a motorcycle with a trailer) to run a taxi service.

With the loan, he will have enough money to buy the Tuk Tuk and earn more income to support his family. For his future plan, Saroeurng is going to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy a Tuk Tuk (a motorcycle with a trailer) to run a taxi service

loans.name: Silvana

texts.es:
Silvana es de la ciudad de Concepción, su meta es poder  terminar su carrera de enfermería, se ve de aquí en adelante siendo toda una profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Su aspiración es terminar su carrera para trabajar y ayudar también a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de su tesis, y de esa manera cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Silvana is from the city of Concepcion. Her goal is to be able to complete her course in nursing, seeing that going forward it's a profession that helps the less fortunate. Her aspiration is to complete her training and also be able to help her family. She asks for this loan to cover the costs of her schooling, and that way also be able to cover the costs she has.

loans.use: Cover education costs.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. He offers motorcycle transport services to the people in his village, especially students within the city. He wants to continue offering safe travel to all passengers and achieve good profits from it. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy oil and tires and pay the registration fee for his motorcycle.

In the future, Ricardo hopes to manage his business well and save funds for education and his family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy oil and tires and pay the registration fee for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lolita is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lolita has a banana vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lolita has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Gesa

texts.en:
Gesa is 31 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Gesa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like condiments, canned goods, snack foods, home-care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Gesa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like condiments, canned goods, snack foods, home-care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Hazen

texts.en:
Hazen is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over a year, Hazen has operated an open-air food business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. Hazen wants to use this KES 10,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of  wheat flour  and cooking fat.

loans.name: Aquelina

texts.en:
Aquelina lives in Maliana, and she is a businesswoman. Her business is selling vegetables. Every day she is always busy with her business, because she goes to places where people planted vegetables to buy vegetables from there. After that, she will bring the vegetables to the market for resale, so she is very happy with the business.

She has been involved in business activity since 2013, with her own working capital. She is earning a good income because she is selling in the center of the market. She is requesting a loan of $1,500 because she wants to buy more vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbage, capsicum, and others.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, capsicum, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a woman who is very interested in business. She is not overly dependent on her husband to be responsible in the household. So now she is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital to buy more goods such as onion, garlic, nuts, betel, maize, and vegetables because she plans to open a bigger business in the future.

She opened her business in 2014 with a capital base of 500 USD. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy onion, garlic, nuts, betel, maize, vegetables and other foods.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, su meta es ser un profesional que sirva en la sociedad, ser un buen abogado.
Comenta que sus padres siempre lo han apoyado en toda su carrera, y siempre han estado con el en todo lo que necesita, y cuando termine su carrera quiere poder ayudarles económicamente.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de su matrícula, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Juan is studying for a career in law, his goal is to be a professional who serves society, to be a good lawyer. His parents have always supported him throughout his educational career, and have always given him everything he needs. When he completes his education he wants to be able to help them financially. He requests this loan to cover the enrollment costs at university, so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: Pay for university enrollment.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 50 years old and married, with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Alicia has an oyster farm in the Philippines. She has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her oyster farm.

Alicia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her oyster farm.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and four of her children are in school.

Mary Jane has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy needed materials like bamboo.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy needed materials like bamboo.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 37 años de edad, es un hombre responsable y muy trabajador, está acompañado, junto a su pareja tienen 2 hijos que están estudiando.

Juan, toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura, debido aque sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela; desde pequeño trabajaba cultivando la tierra junto a su papá, porque de está manera genera ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

Juan, necesita el préstamo para pagar mozos para cortar la cosecha de maíz, porque tiene cultivados 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y él solo no da abasto para cortarla toda. 

Juan, sueña con ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Juan, 37, is a responsible and very hardworking man; he has a partner, with whom he has 2 kids in school. 

All his life Juan has worked in agriculture, because his parents didn't give him the opportunity to attend school; since he was little he worked, farming the land together with his dad, because this this generated income to cover the necessities of his family. 

Juan needs a loan to pay workers to cut the the corn crop, because he has 14,000 square meters of corn and he can't cut it all by himself. 

Juan dreams of helping his kids so they can study and be professionals.

loans.use: To pay workers to cut the corn crop.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her four children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family, and he has been running his own mobile shop for past year.

Gulnaz's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Gulnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that her husband can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Gulnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his mobile business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mukhtiar Bibi

texts.en:
Mukhtiar is the age of 36 and a mother of five children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. But Mukhtiar engages in a school canteen to earn an income. She started her school canteen business eight years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. She is a brave and hardworking woman.

Now Mukhtiar wants to buy school canteen items such as biscuits, cake, milk, chairs, cups and kettles etc. from the market but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase more items. She has decided that she would like to buy more items directly from the market, so that she can earn a better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the school canteen business. So, Mukhtiar demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.
Mukhtiar and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.
.

loans.use: to invest in her canteen business

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania es de Coronel Oviedo, estudia la carrera de medicina veterinaria, en el Futuro desea dedicarse a su profesión. Es una persona muy dedicada, que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de sus estudios, es por ello que pone su mayor esfuerzo para lograrlo.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos variados de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Tania is from Coronel Oviedo. She is studying veterinary medicine. In the future, she hopes to work in her profession. She is a very dedicated person, who wants to improve her living conditions through her studies, which is why she makes her best effort to achieve it.

She requests this loan to be able to cover the various costs of her university, in a way that she will be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to cover various costs of university

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias es de la ciudad de Villarrica, viene de una familia trabajadora que en todo momento e apoya en las buenas y en las malas.
Estudia la carrera de Química y Farmacia, y comenta que su meta es ser alguien en la vida superarse y cumplir sus anhelos de ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de sus estudios y continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Elias is from the city of Villarrica. He comes from a hard-working family that in every moment he helps, in good times and in bad.

He is majoring in Chemistry and Pharmacy, and says that his goal is to be someone in life, to excel, and to reach his dreams of helping his loved ones.

He requests this loan to be able to pay the fees for his studies and continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Noong Luong 37 Group

texts.en:
Thoa is a 30-year-old Thai ethnic woman who is married and has two children. Her family lives happily in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a small village where people mainly rely on agriculture for a living. Like other villagers, Thoa and her husband work very hard at farming and breeding with several activities such as growing rice, raising pigs, chickens and ducks.

When she was a child, she only got the chance to study at the primary education level and she really wants her children to be able to receive a full education. For that reason, she has always wanted to expand production to increase earnings for her family. This is the third time that Thoa has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy a sow and develop pig farming.

She hopes that her investment will go well and help her reap a good profit. She dreams of a more abundant life for her family and a brighter future for her children. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy a sow and develop pig farming

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El comité LAS MERCEDES esta trabajando de manera unida hace 4 ciclos, son mujeres muy emprendedoras que se destacan por su trabajo en equipo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Isidora, quien se dedica a la cría de animales y además de eso cuenta con un copetín en su propia casa donde vende minutas como empanadas y marineras, preparando también para el almuerzo de los trabajadores de la zona.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de animales para la cría, y balanceados para poder seguir con la cría de los mismos y mejorar sus ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Las Mercedes" group has been working together for four loan cycles. They are very enterprising women who stand out for their teamwork.

One of the members if Isidora, who makes a living breeding animals. In addition to this, she has a snack bar at her own house where she sells quick meals like empanadas and seafood. She also prepares lunch for workers in the area.

She is requesting a loan to buy animals for breeding and animal feed. In this way she will be able to continue breeding them and increase her income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy animals for breeding and animal feed.

loans.name: Km 66 Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Km  66 está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres muy trabajadoras que vieron una oportunidad de mejorar sus vidas a través del programa de comités.
Entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Lourdes quien ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con una despensa que tiene en su casa, comenta que con sacrificio montó su negocio y que hoy ya es conocida en el barrio, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa con productos variados, como ser; panes, carne, condimentos, pollo, bebidas y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group is called Km 66. It is in its third cycle of its women's committee program. They are very hard-working women who see an opportunity to improve their lives through the committee program. 

They include Ms. Lourdes, who supports the sustenance of her family with a pantry she has in her house. She says that with sacrifice, she set up her business and today it is known in the neighborhood. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. 

She requests this loan to be able to fill her pantry with a variety of products, such as bread, meat, spices, chicken, drinks, and others. She appreciates the opportunity she receives to be able to grow and improve her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy pantry products, such as bread, meat, spices, chicken, drinks and others.

loans.name: Aabida Baigum

texts.en:
Aabida is the age of 39 and a mother of two children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. But Mukhtiar engages in a bed sheet business to earn an income. She started her bed sheet business four years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. She is a brave and hardworking woman.

Now Aabida wants to buy bed sheets from the market but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase more items. She has decided that she would like to buy more items directly from the market, so that she can earn a better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the bed sheet business. So, Aabida requested a loan so she will be able to buy bed sheets from the market.

Aabida and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.
.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Madre Central Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina MADRE CENTRAL, es un grupo muy unido y numeroso con 24 integrantes, es un comité fortalecido y desde hace tiempo están trabajando  con el programa Comité de Mujeres Rurales, son muy luchadoras y ponen todo de si para poder crecer.
La Sra. Magdalena es quien cumple el rol de presidenta de este comité, es muy emprendedora y sus actividades se basan en el cultivo, cría de animales y venta de productos de origen vegetal y animal. Ciertos días de la semana ella junto con sus compañeras de comité se instalan frente al local de fundación paraguaya con su feria de productos donde acuden muchas personas debido a que la calidad de sus productos son buenas y a precios realmente accesibles.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de semillas para cultivar y balanceados para animales que ella cría. Agradece por la oportunidad de crecer y mejorar que recibe.
texts.en:
The group is called "Madre Central." It is a very unified group with 24 members; it is also a strong group. For some time, they have been working with the program for Groups of Rural Women. They are determined and all they have into being able to grow.

Mrs. Magdalena is fills the role of president of the group. She is very enterprising, and her activities are based on agriculture, raising animals, and selling vegetable and animal products. Certain days of the week, she and her friends in the group set up in front of the Fundación Paraguaya location with all of their products displayed. Many people come here because the quality of products is good and the prices are accessible.

She asks for this loan to buy seeds to cultivate and balanced feed for the animals that she raises. She is thankful for the opportunity to grow and improve that she receives.

loans.use: to buy seeds to cultivate and balanced feed for the animals she raises.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara está estudiando la carrera de Ciencias Contables, está trabajando y ayudando a su padre y cuando obtenga su título espera poder abrir mi propio estudio contable.
Ella es una persona que se esfuerza por poder crecer y salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Clara is studying an accounting degree, she is working and helping her father. She hopes to open her own accounting firm after obtaining her title.

She is a person who strives to be able to grow and succeed. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the instalment fees for her degree and to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay instalment fees for the university.

loans.name: Gabriel Orlando

texts.es:
Gabriel, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, creció en un ambiente familiar en donde todo se logra a través de sacrificio y de esfuerzo, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 3 hijos que están estudiando y en su casa vive su esposa, su abuela y sus 3 hijos.

Gabriel, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, todo lo que sabe de la agricultura lo aprendió gracias a su padre; pero aparte de trabajar cultivando, también es miembro activo en un grupo musical.

Gabriel, necesita el préstamo para pagar mano de obra que le ayude a cortar la cosecha de maíz y de frijol.

Sus sueños son, colocar su propio negocio de productos de la canasta básica (tienda) y seguir apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio.
