texts.en:
Gabriel, 31, studied up to the sixth grade, grew up in a family environment where everything was achieved through sacrifice and effort. He is married, his wife works domestic jobs, they have 3 kids in school, and his wife, grandma, and 3 kids live in his house.  

Gabriel farms basic grains, he learned everything he knows about agriculture from his father; but apart from his farm work he is also an active member of a band. 

Gabriel needs a loan to pay workers to help him cut the corn and bean crops.

His dreams are to have his own basic goods store, and to continue helping his kids with their studies.

loans.use: To pay workers to help him cut the corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a mat-making business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Angie requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a barn load of palm and other materials for her business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a barn load of palm and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru:
Адолат молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 20 лет. Она вдова. Так как её муж недавно умер. Она имеет 1-го ребенка. Она живет в городской местности с родителями.
Адолат швея.  Она работает в ателье. Шьет национальные платья на заказ, тем самым зарабатывает на жизнь. Несмотря на все сложности жизни, Адолат остается жизнерадостной девушкой.  Ее работа очень нравится ей.
В МДО Арванд Адолат обратилась впервые, когда узнала что есть возможность финансовой поддержки. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес. Кредит хочет использовать на покупку материала для расширения своего бизнеса. Она заранее благодарна за предоставленную помощь МДО «Арванд» и надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Adolat is a young and cheerful woman of 20. She is a widow, as her husband died not long ago. She has a one-year-old child and lives in an urban area with her parents. She is a seamstress and works in an atelier sewing traditional dresses to order as a means of earning a living. Despite all the difficulties in her life, she remains a cheerful young woman and likes her work very much.

Adolat approached Arvand as soon as she found out that there was a possibility of financial support. She wants to expand her business. A loan will allow her to purchase fabric to expand her business. She expresses her thanks in advance for assistance from Arvand and hopes for further cooperation.

loans.use: to buy fabric to expand her business

loans.name: Havasmo

texts.ru:
Хавасмо трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 55 лет. У неё пятеро детей. Она своих детей  вырастила и воспитывала одна. Ее дети уже взрослые и живут почти все отдельно от нее. Она живет в сельской местности. 
Вот уже на протяжении нескольких лет она занимается куплей продажей фруктов и овощей. Хавасмо  торгует на рынке. Ей нравится ее работа. Ее работа приносит хорошую прибыль. 
Этот бизнес приносит ей постоянный хороший доход. И сейчас Хавасмо хочет расширить свой бизнес. Поэтому она хочет взять кредит для закупа большого ассортимента овощей и фруктов. Для получения кредита она обратась в Арванд и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Havasmo is a hardworking and cheerful woman of 55. She has five children, whom she raised and cared for on her own. Her children are all grown up and live almost entirely independently from her. She lives in a rural area and works in retail at the market. She has been buying and selling fruits and vegetables for several years. She likes her work, which brings in a good income.

This business brings Havasmo a regular, good income. Now she wants to expand her business. Therefore she wants to take out a loan to buy a larger selection of fruits and vegetables. She has approached Arvand for a loan and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Tayyaba

texts.en:
Tayyaba is a 29-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband has owned a barber shop for the past 15 years. He is the guardian of the family and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members.

Tayyaba's husband needs to buy different types of cosmetics such as creams, hairbrushes, seats and other accessories for his barber shop but due to financial constraints her husband is not able to buy these items for his business purposes. Therefore Tayyaba has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her husband to buy the relevant items for his business purposes so that her husband can provide better services to his customers. It will also be helpful for him to earn a maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of his business and family.

For this financial assistance Tayyaba is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his barber business.

loans.name: Gulruhon

texts.ru:
Гулрухон молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 31 лет. Она вдова. Она одна воспитывает троих детей. Её муж умер в 2012 году. Она живет в сельской местности. 
Гулрухон занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении нескольких лет она занимается купля продажей фруктов и овощей.Этот бизнес приносит ей постоянный хороший доход. 
И сейчас Гулрухон хочет расширить свой бизнес. Поэтому она хочет взять кредит для закупа большого ассортимента овощей и фруктов. Для получения кредита она обратилась в Арванд и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Gulruhon is a young and cheerful woman of 31. She is a widow and raising three children on her own. Her husband died in 2012. She lives in a rural area and runs her own business buying and selling fruits and vegetables, an occupation she has had for several years. This business brings her a good and steady income.

Gulruhon wants to expand her business. Therefore she wants to take out a loan to buy a larger selection of fruits and vegetables. She has approached Arvand for a loan and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her selection of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
Чумагул доброжелательная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 45 лет.  Она замужем и имеет трое детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Чумагул мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Чумагул выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Чумагул никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Чумагул вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Чумагула выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнесаЧумагул получает хороший доход. Муж Чумагул работает лесником и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Чумагул с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Чумагул заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Jumagul is a kindhearted and hardworking woman of 45. She is married and has three children. She lives in a small rural village. As a child she dreamed of becoming a teacher but circumstances did not allow her to receive a higher education, because of financial difficulties in her family. Immediately after finishing high school she got married and became a homemaker. But even though she stays at home all the time, she never sits idle. She and her husband try to do everything possible to give their children everything they need.

In order to receive a steady income to pay for food, Jumagul and her husband started their own animal husbandry business. She raises cattle and sells the meat and milk she receives from them. She earns a good living from this business. Her husband works in forestry and his job brings in additional income. Their total income covers average living costs, but they don't have enough to pay for everything they need.

Right now, Jumagul and her husband want to buy a few more head of cattle for fattening. Therefore she has approached Arvand and wants to take out a loan to buy cattle. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support, which will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San Francisco, las integrantes son de la ciudad de Itá, están trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias, y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Liliana se dedica a vender comidas y comenta que le va muy bien, y ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las delicias que prepara. Comenta que poco a poco ha ido mejorando y creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos,  panificados, y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
This group is called "San Francisco." The members are from the city of Itá. They are working in the program to eliminate poverty to be able to improve the conditions of their lives and those of their families and to give them a better quality life.

Liliana is dedicated to selling food, and she says that it is going very well. She has very good clients, who always buy the delicious good she prepares. She says that little by little the business has been improving and growing.

She asks for this loan to be able to buy supplies to make her food, including vegetables, meat, condiments, bread products, and other things. In this way, she will be able to continue fighting for her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food, including vegetables, meat, condiments, bread products, and other things.

loans.name: Boqueron 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Boqueron 2” trabaja dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una de las integrantes se esfuerza por mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias. Son mujeres muy luchadoras y trabajadoras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Evelin, quien tiene una despensa, con mucho sacrificio ha podido montar para su negocio y de esa forma puede tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y que  no tengan que pasar por ninguna necesidad.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas, panificados, verduras, frutas y otros, de manera a poder tener una mayor variedad de productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group is called "Boqueron 2." They work in the program to eliminate poverty, in which each of the members works to improve the conditions of their families lives. They are very determined and hard working women.

One of the members is Mrs. Evelin, who has a general store. With a lot of sacrifice, she has been able to establish her business, and in this way, she has the means to be able to help her family so that they don't lack any necessity.

She asks for this loan to be able to buy drinks, bread products, vegetables, fruit and other things. In this way, she will have a bigger variety of products that she can offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy products for her store, including drinks, bread products, vegetables, fruit and other things.

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
El señor Cosme es antiguo y excelente cliente de la fundación, trabajando, él se dedica a la fabricación y venta de forros y estuches para Guitarras, arpas, entre otros instrumentos musicales.
El Sr. Cosme comenta que se dedica a este rubro hace 15 años, tiene clientes por todos lados, y esto le permite hacerse conocido y por medio de su trabajo poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, cierres y otros insumos para poder seguir con sus confecciones y venta de forros y estuches.
texts.en:
Mr. Cosme is a veteran member of the foundation. Through his work, he makes a living from the manufacture and sale of bags and cases for guitars, harps and other musical instruments. Mr. Cosme comments that he has been working on this activity for 15 years. He has customers everywhere, which allows him to earn a reputation and thus to help his family.

He requests this loan in order to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other supplies to continue sewing and selling bags and cases.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers and other supplies to continue sewing and selling bags and cases.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: Рустамчон их города Худжанд. Ему 21 лет. Он холост. Рустамчон живет вместе с отцом и матерью. Он один сын в семье. Рустамчон самостоятельный и жизнелюбивый сын. Он работает, и обеспечить семью. Рустамчон  занимается оператором по съемки свадебные мероприятия.  Его отец монтирует записей, который его сын снимал свадебные мероприятия. Рустамчон работает вместе отцом, ему научил его отец. Рустамчон уже стал опытным оператором. Он научился много чего. Рустамчон имеет дорогую снимочную камеру. Его камера является источником дохода, помощью камеру Рустамчон зарабатывает на жизнь. Он хочет починить свою камеру, чтобы не потерять источник дохода. Рустамчон на месяц принимает 15-20 заказов.  Ему надо по скорее починит камеру, и начать работу. Рустамчону не хватает денег на ремонт камеры, и из-за нехватки он просит кредит.
texts.en:
Rustamjon is from the city of Khujand. He is 21 and single and lives with his parents. He is the only son in the family and is an independent and cheerful son. He works as a camera operator, filming weddings to help care for the family. His father edits the recordings that his son shoots at weddings. He works with his father, who taught him his skills. He has already become an experienced filmmaker and learned a lot. 

Rustamjon has a good video camera. It is his source of income and he uses it to earn a living. He wants to repair his camera so as not to lose his source of income. He takes about 15 to 20 orders a month, and he needs to fix his camera soon so he can get working. He doesn't have enough money to pay for repairs and therefore is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to fix his video camera

loans.name: Marina De La Cruz

texts.es:
Marina, de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado, no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de recursos; está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos viven en su casa y los otros tres ya se acompañaron. 

Marina, tiene una tienda desde hace 25 años, decidió colocar este negocio porque en el lugar donde vive no hay tiendas cerca y ella vio que había una oportunidad de negocio y la aprovecho, pero además de eso también cultiva la tierra desde hace 3 años, pues ella le ayuda a su esposo en los trabajos agrícolas.

Marina, necesita el préstamo para surtir más la tienda e incrementar su inventario con productos como arroz, azúcar, pan, detergentes, entre otros.

Sus sueños son mantener su tienda y ayudarle siempre a su esposo para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marina, 47 years old, attended school up to the first grade. She couldn't continue with her studies due to a lack of resources. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and also has 5 children, two of whom live with her at home while the other three are married.

Marina has had a store for 25 years. She decided to start the business because where she lives there are no stores close by, so she saw a business opportunity and seized it. In addition to this, she has also worked in farming for three years, helping her husband with his work.

Marina needs this loan in order to stock her store and bulk up her inventory with products like rice, sugar, bread, detergents, and other items. Her dreams are to maintain her store and assist her husband, so they can help their children move ahead.

loans.use: to stock her store and grow her inventory with products like rice, sugar, bread, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 30 years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces no challenges in her business.

With the requested loan of KES 25,000 Khadija wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has no piped water but does have electricity. She cites rent as her greatly monthly expense.

Riziki has operated a beauty salon for the past two years. Her potential customers are her neighbors and people at the marketplace. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating new hairdressing skills in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 25,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio es una persona muy trabajadora, día a día empieza su trabajo desde muy tempranas horas, tiene su carpintería la cual es el medio de ayudar a su familia con todo lo que necesitan, comenta que con su préstamo anterior pudo  surtir su taller de manera a poder cumplir con sus clientes.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar maderas en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir haciendo sus muebles y cumplir de una buena manera con sus clientes. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de crecer.
texts.en:
Arsenio is a very hard-working person who begins work in his carpentry workshop every day during the early hours. This is how he supports his family with everything they need. He says that with his previous loan he was able to stock his work shop which allowed him to meet his clients needs.

Today he is applying for a new loan in order to buy wood in bulk so he will be able to continue making furniture and fulfil his customers expectations. He is grateful for this new opportunity to grow.

loans.use: to buy wood in bulk.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a 48-year-old, married woman with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mylene has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as soft drinks, canned goods, and other groceries.

Mylene has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft drinks, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors taking a long time to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Daima

texts.en:
Daima is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase Irish potatoes, charcoal, wheat flour, and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes, charcoal, wheat flour, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Amina owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Amina operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama MUJERES UNIDAS, es un grupo unido pasaron al segundo ciclo, está conformada por mujeres muy sacrificadas que quieren dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
Entre ellas se destaca a la señora Maria quien se dedica a la cría de animales en su casa, y también se desempeña como cantinera en una institución educativa de la comunidad, en donde ofrece a los alumnos y docentes para el desayuno y merienda alimentos preparados higiénicamente.
Es una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora, pide este préstamo para la compra de animales de corral para la cría y alimentos para estos, de manera a poder seguir con su emprendimiento y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This committee is called Women United, it's a united group who have gone through their second cycle. It's comprised of women who make every sacrifice to give their families' better quality of life. Maria is a stand out among them who makes a living raising animals in her home, and she also works in the cafeteria of an institute of higher learning in the community where she has food offerings for the students and professors for breakfast, and light meals prepared hygienically. 

She is a hard-working woman who sacrifices, she requests this loan for the purchase of barnyard animals to raise and feed for them. This way she'll be able to continue with her business and helping her family.

loans.use: purchase barnyard animals for raising and feed.

loans.name: Gulam Ayesha

texts.en:
Gulam Ayesha is a 44-year-old woman living with her husband and seven children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a responsible woman. Her husband is an honest person. He is an honorable personality in the society. He is a social worker.

He is the owner of a small restaurant in which he offers many types of delicious foods. He offers breakfast and lunch to his customers. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earning insufficient profits due to the ugly condition of this restaurant. He cooks the delicious food for his customers, and the people like to eat there.

The condition of his restaurant is very bad; there is a low sitting arrangement, it has rough walls, a dark room, and no electricity supplies are available. The customers feel hesitant to come inside the restaurant.

Gulam Ayesha’s husband wants to establish his restaurant by redecorating it. He wants to paint the walls, provide an electricity supply, and buy new furniture. Therefore, Gulam Ayesha has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can redecorate his restaurant.

Gulam Ayesha will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall, and her customers are her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, which can mean the loss of perishable goods.

With the requested loan of KES 50,000, Kavumbi wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flours, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flours, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the requested loan of KES 50,000, Kwekwe wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Dhanalakshmi And Group

texts.en:
Dhanalakshmi leads a group of five women who have come together to request a group loan to start their own businesses. The loan will help these women achieve more reliable sources of income, income that will help them meet their families' needs and save for their children’s education.

After undergoing training from Gramalaya Microfin Foundation (GMF), Dhanalakshmi will use her loan portion to start a business making masala powder. She is 39 years of age and lives with her husband and two children in the Namakkal district of Tamil Nadu. She currently works as a daily wage labourer in the agricultural sector, the income from which is both inconsistent and insufficient. She has thus decided to start her own business and expects her monthly income to increase by Rs.2500.

loans.use: start her masala powder-making business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as her greatly monthly expenses.

Susan has operated a beauty salon for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbors and people at the marketplace. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating new hairdressing skills in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 25,000, Susan wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Salma Bibi

texts.en:
Salma is 52 years old and the mother of three children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband is a builder. He has been running a small construction company for 20 years to meet the family’s expenses.

Nowadays Salma’s husband wants to buy sheltering materials to improve his income, but he is unable due to insufficient finances. Therefore, Salma has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Salma’s husband can purchase sheltering materials to earn an income.

Salma and her family will be thankful to the KIVA lenders and their field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy sheltering material for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a bookstore for the three years. She faces a lot of competition. She requests a loan to buy books, pens, pencils, and other items. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase books, pens, pencils, and other stationary items.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 48-year-old married woman with five children two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Teresita has had a general store business for 3 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, canned goods, home care products, and groceries.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman with two school-aged children. She rents a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Anna operates a stall to sell vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces high costs of transportation to her place of work.


With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, crates of tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Seperanca

texts.en: Seperanca is 33 years old. She is married and a businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop and she also sells merchandise in the market. Seperanca has been involved in this business since 2013, when she started it with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income from her business because many people like to buy her products, so she is still happy doing her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to  buy more items like detergents, soaps, cooking oils, shampoo, sugar, water, plastics, combs, toothpaste, and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy detergents, soaps, cooking oils, shampoo, sugar, water, plastics, combs, toothpaste, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Fatima Ashfaq

texts.en:
Fatima is 21-year-old mother with three children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a responsible to meet the needs of the entire family. Her husband is an electrician and repairs water pumps, irons, and air coolers. He has operated the shop 15 years to meet the family’s expenses.

Fatima’s husband wants to buy electrical supplies but cannot, due to insufficient finances. Fatima has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Fatima’s husband will use the loan to purchase electrical instruments to earn additional income.

Fatima and her family are thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy electric materials for husband's shop

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with three school-age children. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Amina operates a stall to sell vegetables at the market. She has high costs for transportation to her place of business.



With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a home-based soft drink/fruit juice business. She faces challenges of a seasonal business and the high cost of transporting raw materials.

She will use the loan to purchase fruit, mangoes, and passion fruit to make fruit juice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, mangoes, and passion fruit.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and running water.

She has operated a retail business for one year to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of not paying their credit in a timely manner.

She will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother with three children, all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

She has operated a home-based food selling business for 1 year. She faces the challenges of a seasonal business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Trabajadoras están trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza como un medio de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, sumado a su esfuerzo y las capacitaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Vicenta quien se dedica al humilde trabajo de venta de remedios naturales, ella por medio de este trabajo tiene los medios para poder dar a su familia los medios para una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Vicenta es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere crecer y es por ello que pone todo de sí.
La señora pide este préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo y cumplir con sus clientes y su familia.
texts.en:
The group is called Mujeres Trabajadoras. They are working in the poverty elimination program as a means to improve their living conditions, coupled with their effort and training.

One of the members is Ms. Vicenta, who makes a living in the humble work of selling natural remedies. Through this work, she has the means to give her family the means for a life of dignity without hardships like those she had to face. Vicenta is a very hard-working woman who wants to grow and for this she gives her all. The woman requests this loan for the purchase of natural remedies for sale so that she can continue with her sales as she has been, and to meet the needs of her clients and her family.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies for sale

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en:
Aimee is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. One attends school.

Aimee has raised pigs for 3 years and requests 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 5 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Aimee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda began her business in 2013 with her capital of $50.00. She is applying for a loan of 800,00. USD to improve her business. She is 28 years old and her husband is a business man also.

She has a home-based kiosk and will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy noodles, soap, detergent, biscuits, candies, cooking oil, candles, glue, shampoo, soft drinks and other items.

She will use the loan to improve the management of her business.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, biscuits, noodles, candies, cooking oil, candles, glue, shampoo, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
A $ 1000.00 is offered to Teresa to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come. She will use the loan to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, soap, water, slippers, and shampoo.She has been in business since 2010 and is comfortable running her business to earn money every day.

Running a business has made Teresa independent because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar ,coffee, salt, soap, water, slippers, and shampoo.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated a home-based business to sell food. She faces a major challenge of transportation to her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase  wheat flour, maize flour,  and cooking fat.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de Diciembre está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa.
Ella se dedica a hacer comidas, comenta que todos los días inicia su trabajo desde muy temprano ya que se levanta a hacer sus comidas y después las vende por su barrio, ella se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, panificados, y otros, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group of December 8 is in its second cycle of its women's committee program, where the members are working to eliminate poverty. 

One of the members is Ms. Rosa. Her work is making food. She says that every day she begins her work very early to make her food and later sell it in her neighborhood. She defines herself as a very hardworking person and a fighter.

She requests this loan to be able to buy supplies to make her food, such as meat, condiments, baked goods, and others, and she is thankful for the opportunity to grow and get better.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food, such as meat, condiments, baked goods, and others

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a 37-year-old retail shop proprietor living in Mombasa, Kenya. She has two childen and has been in this business for twenty years.

This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya, she has successfully repaid her loans. She will use the new loan to purchase charcoal, beans, maize, rice, cooking fat, and green vegetables.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. She hopes to have a happy family in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal,  beans, maize, rice, cooking fat, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Azenith

texts.en:
Azenith is 33 years old and married, Azenith works very hard to provide for them.

Azenith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Azenith has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Azenith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  canned goods, personal  care products, and groceries.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 62 years old and has eight children. Conchita is a married woman.

Conchita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Conchita has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Diosdada is 53 years old and has three children who are in school.

Diosdada has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines. Diosdada requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Diosdada has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Diosdada would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is an active poor woman whose efforts are geared to develop her business. She is married with children and lives in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She operates a home-based bar to earn an income for the family. This is supplemented by farming and selling second-hand clothes.

Harriet's wants to improve her standards of living, construct a permanent house, and educate her children. Harriet still has a long way to go to accomplish all her dreams. Harriet will use the loan to purchase beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin, 58, is a farmer living in one-bedroom house located in Kampong Thom province. He has four children, one of whom is dependent on him and needs him to support their studies. He has been working as a government officer to support his family's living for 30 years. Meanwhile, he has been growing rice and selling palm sugar to get additional income. He earns income of only about 11 USD per day and can save around 6 USD each day after daily expenses. Chin is new to VisionFund. He will use his loan to pay for school fees for his daughter. He hopes that this loan will enable his daughter to study in university and get a job that pays well after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay for school fees for his daughter.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en:
Rudik is a 34-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two children in Senaki district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig and two cows. Rudik's wife produces cheese to sell with piglets at a local market at a good price. Rudik is an artisan and he repairs cars. He has a good number of clients and generates daily income. He needs equipment to work more effectively and increase income.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2,500 USD. With the received credit he will purchase equipment which will help him to generate more income and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment which will help him to work more effectively and increase income.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a widowed woman with one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. In addition, she operates a fruit-selling business that earns her another source of income.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is a 35-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a shop in which he sells bed sheets, pillows, foam mattress, blankets, etc. Recently, he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which diminished his purchasing power to buy new blankets.

Now customers want blankets because the winter season is going to start. Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's business. He will utilize the loan amount to purchase blankets and bed sheets.

Her dream is to provide all facilities to her children.

Rehana is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy blankets and bed sheets for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is a married woman with five children who works hard to support her family.

She sells fish and earns additional income raising pigs. Emerita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish to sell .

Emerita has sustained her business through 13 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Fe Presentacion

texts.en:
Fe Presentacion is a 66 year-old widowed woman with three children. For the past seven years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Fe Presentacion is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Fe Presentacion is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, cigarettes, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, beverages, cigarettes, and other groceries

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a married woman, 59 years old, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Amy has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. Amy requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Amy has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gedeliza

texts.en:
Gedeliza is 39 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Gedeliza works very hard to provide for them.

Gedeliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like beverages, bread, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries.

Gedeliza has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Gedeliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like beverages, bread, canned goods, junk foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 55-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who does business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear clothing like dresses, underwear, t-shirts, shorts, etc. to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing like dresses, underwear, t-shirts, shorts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is 59 years old and is married with ten children. Four of her children are presently in school. For the past two years, Nita has run a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has borrowed four previous loans through NWTF to sustain her business.

Nita is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 51 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Felisa works very hard to provide for them.

Felisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries.

Felisa has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman who has been blessed with three children. For the past 20 years, she has operated a farming business, selling her produce retail and at the local market to residents and restaurant operators. Joyce owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Joyce decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Joyce is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase seeds and seedlings for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Haikona Ageteraine Kukurakurana Group

texts.en:
Harriet (shown with her hand raised) is a thirty-three-year-old woman with five children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda.

She owns a bar to sell beer, alcohol, and sodas. She works around the clock to generate income for her family. She loves her business to grow but faces financial challenges. Harriet has asked for a loan to buy beer and sodas to sell. She is a member of the group where there is group pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL es un joven padre de familia el cual esta presentando problemas dentales, necesita un tratamiento urgente de endodoncia para poder solucionar su problema, sin embargo debido a que él es el único sustento de su familia sus recursos no le alcanzan para poder solventar el tratamiento.
texts.en:
He is a young father who has dental problems. He urgently needs endodontic treatment to be able to fix his problem.

However, because he is the sole support of his family, he does not have enough resources to pay for this treatment.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Thom province, Kun, 47, is a father of a child. To make a living, he has been growing rice for years. Moreover, he has been working for others for a fee to earn more income. His daily income is about 5USD per day and he can save around 3USD each day after expenses.

The farming business has been threatened by drought and flood. He is now applying for a loan from VisionFund and this is the first time for him. He will spend it on paying for school fees for his nephew. He hopes to see his nephew have a bright future after graduating and he hopes to earn more income to upgrade the living standard.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his nephew.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en: Suzana lives in Maliana and earns a daily incomefrom her business. She is  applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. Suzana started her business in 2010 with $500.00.  She and her husband wish  to buy coffee, eggs, cooking oil, detergent, shampoo, candies, soft drinks, and other items to sell. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy coffee, eggs, cooking oil, detergent, shampoo, candies, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Sra. Nancy es de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de todo tipo que ella trae desde la Argentina, es una mujer muy luchadora, hace 10 años que se dedica a este trabajo y es con el cual ha sacado adelante a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos variados para la venta, como ser: harina, aceite, bebidas, pañal, etc. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Nancy is from the city of Encarnación. She sells all types of products that she gets from Argentina. She is a very tenacious woman. She has been engaged in this work for ten years, and with this work she has gotten her family ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various products like flour, cooking oil, drinks, and diapers, etc. to sell. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting to be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy various products like flour, cooking oil, drinks, and diapers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en:
Eufrocina is widowed and has three children. She works selling fish at the public market. 

Eufrocina is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more milkfish, crabs, and shrimp to sell. She plans to use the profit from her loan for education purposes. Eufrocina will continue offering affordable goods and friendly service to all of her customers.

loans.use: to buy milkfish, crabs, and shrimp to sell

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a married woman and her husband is in construction. Amani needs to renovate her house and buy property to be ready for the winter. Amani is 22 years old and pregnant. She hopes to have a beautiful home for her child in the near future.

Amani is requesting $1,000 to renovate her house and buy carpets and furniture to be ready for the winter.

loans.use: to renovate her house and buy carpets and furniture.

loans.name: Kankangeyo Kabbongotukolenamani Group

texts.en:
Annah is a committed and active group member of Kankangeyo KabbongoTukolenamani. She has nine children. She works hard to sustain her big family and supplements her husband's income. She is 46 years old and lives in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She buys produce and farms. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Annah requests a loan to buy beans and maize.

loans.use: to buy  beans and maize.

loans.name: Murni

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Murni, who is a 39-year-old married woman with one son and two daughters. Murni is a housewife and her husband is an employee.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source in their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Murni will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source in their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for the family.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyen is 47 years old. She is married and has four children, two of them have a job.

She would like to take a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living conditions and health for her family.

Her income is mainly from a small business so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Nyerere Group

texts.en:
Amer is in his early 50's years. He is a divorcee with three children who are still in school. He has been running a gengeduka (small shop with fruit and vegetables) business for twelve years now. He works from 08 am to 06 pm daily and is able to make a very good profit per month.

This will be Amer's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the genge and opened a duka. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.

He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, to reinvest in business, bought a plot of land, started building his own house and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the gengeduka store. He dreams of expanding his business.

Amer will share this loan with his loan group NYERERE which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in his gengeduka store.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman and has been blessed with seven children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a farming business, selling at retail and at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase fertilizers and seedlings in her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her farming business.

loans.name: Aizhan

texts.en:
Aizhan is an 18-year-old freshman in the Business Administration Program at AUCA. This year she finished one of the local schools with excellent marks and her parents are proud of her because she was the best graduate of her school.

Education for Aizhan is not only acquiring information during all those years of steady work, but also leading to personal improvement, expanding of ideas, eliminating traditional thinking, breaking conventionality, and creating things that would change the world. For these reasons, the right to education is the thing that she most cherishes.

Aizhan was raised in a family with strict principles, where education is one of the most important things as a pathway to build the future. She notes that both of her parents have graduated from the university with a Diploma of Honor. Maybe thanks to her genes, she is as smart and intelligent a person as her parents.

Aizhan’s dream is to get a degree in business, which is necessary to reach her goals of leading a team that will improve living accommodations in Kyrgyzstan.

At present, Aizhan’s family has a pretty decent income as her parents are both unemployed. Living costs continue to rise, which has been an extreme burden for her parents who are seeking a job, but due to the high rate unemployment in Kyrgyzstan, they are unable to find a good job. She notes that for the old generation, it is hard to compete with the younger one, so she wants to earn a degree in order to be competitive in the future and create new job places by opening her own business.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! this is Agus, one of Ruma's agents. Agus lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only daughter. Agus owns a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He already joined Ruma in 2014 and he feels that since he joined Ruma he learnt a lot about how to improve his business and how to manage another business opportunity, as well as gave more contribution to his community.

As the business keep growing, Agus is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment airtime credits to his community, especially on weekends.

Knowing about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Agus improve his business and accordingly, his community which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Agus is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Noong Luong 38 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan, 25, is a Thai ethnic lady who is married and has become the mother of a small girl. She lives with her husband and her child in a new small house in a remote village and works very hard at agricultural production while her husband works as a truck driver to earn a living.

Because of the instability of income from agriculture, Mrs. Lan diversifies her work into many activities such as growing rice, corn, peanuts, breeding pigs, chickens, ducks and pigeons. This is the fourth time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy baby fish and food for them.

She hopes that the fish will grow fast and healthily, then help her to reap a good profit. Mrs. Lan dreams that her child will study well, enter a good college and have a good job. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish and food for them.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is a 43-year-old mechanic in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a father of four who has been in this business for the last seven years and makes a good income. His wife also supports him with additional income.

This is his third time borrowing from VisionFund to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase spare parts for motorcycles and motor cars and will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. He hopes to have a happy family in future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycles and motor cars.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 58-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like thread, needles, and scissors and to pay for maintenance for her sewing machine.

Josephine has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread, needles, and scissors and to pay for maintenance for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalina is 26 years old and has one child in school.

Rosalina has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosalina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: ROSA: Es una señora sonriente y luchadora de 54 años de edad, madre soltera de 4 hijos mayores de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita de la Ciudad de Bilwi municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace tres años elabora fritos, nacatamales y sopa de viernes a domingo. Está solicitando su primer financiamiento para establecer en el corredor su vivienda de tambo y madera una pequeña pulpería, comprar: granos básicos, chivería, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Rosa is a smiling and tenacious 54 year old woman. She is the single mother of four grown children. She is of Miskita ethnicity and from the city of Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. In order to get her children ahead, for three years she has been making snacks, 'nacatamales' and soup on Fridays through Sundays.

She is requesting her first loan in order to establish a small store on the porch of her wood house that is on stilts. She will buy basic grains and snacks, among other products. She dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to establish a store of the porch of her wooden home built on stilts.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina was born in 1976. She is a married parent of a child. She lives with her family in South Tajikistan.

Zarina is a very hardworking woman. She has her own business deal. Her business is buying and selling women's clothes. She buys women clothes in bulk from the market, which is situated in the capital of Tajikistan. She retails clothes in a local market in her region. Zarina has worked in this field for more than three years.

She periodically renews the assortment of her goods and in this way, she provides a wide assortment of goods. Zarina is going to buy a new assortment of goods and so she is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to widen the assortment of goods she sells.

loans.name: Blandina

texts.en:
Blandina is married and has been blessed with five children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a farming business, selling her produce at the market to local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

Blandina decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this KES 50,000 she wants to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizers and seedlings for a her farming business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married father of 3. He is an employee with a limited salary, but he is working hard to improve his family's living.

Ali is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to pay his children's school tuition fees. The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you are enabling access to education for students with limited options. Ali hopes to both continue supporting his children's education and improve their living.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Mrs. Hoa is a hardworking woman, 27 years old. She is married and has a baby. Her family’s income is mainly from cultivation and husbandry. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 32-year-old mother living with her husband and 4 children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the family's needs.

Fouzia also provides sewing services, contributing income to her husband's in order to manage the household. She needs different kinds of goods for her business such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. However, due to insufficient funds, she is unable to purchase these items.

Therefore Fouzia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above items, provide better sewing services, and increase her monthly sales and profit.

Fouzia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha is 38 years old, married with two children, and both of them are schooling. She works very hard to feed and education her children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially for her children, but she lacks the capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine, and she is able to repay the loan from her small business.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Sonia is also providing sewing services and earning income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods like needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc for her business purpose; but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the accessories she needs and will also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Sonia is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran is 48 years old and a widow. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns by hand. Her skill is known throughout the town.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit. This monetary help can take Naziran closer to her dream of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.name: Vien

texts.en: Mrs. Vien is 44 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to provide for them . Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry. She is interested in improving the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 43 years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Agnes works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, wood, feeds, condiments, dried fish, candies, and other groceries.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like rice, firewood, canned goods, and other groceries.

Agnes has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like rice, firewood, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
It was hard for Abida to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. So, some years ago, she started her business selling animals in her community. Abida is 30 years old, a married woman, and the mother of four children. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Abida has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Santos Juventina

texts.es:
Santos, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, su esposo trabaja en una institución financiera, tienen una hija de 11 años que estudia.


Santos, se dedica a vender cd's y películas, anteriormente este negocio lo atendía su esposo, pero desde que él adquirió otro trabajo ella se atiende el negocio.

Santos, necesita el préstamo para comprar más películas y cd's de canciones, porque en diciembre se venden más por las fiestas de fin de año.

Santos, sueña con tener un puesto propio en el mercado, para no solo vender películas y cd's sino que también comprar ropa para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos, 44, has a 9th grade education.  She is married, and her husband works for a financial institution.  They have an 11 year-old daughter who is in school.

Santos has a business selling CDs and movies.  Previously, her husband managed this business, but since he got another job she has been the one to manage it.

Santos needs a loan to buy more movies and music CDs, because in December sales go up due to the end-of-year festivities.  

Santos dreams of having her own sales stall in the market, where she would sell not only movies and CDs, but also clothing.  This way she could increase her income.

loans.use: to buy movies and music CDs

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Financial constraints along with the desire for a better life and good quality education for her 8 children are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged Zarina to start her business selling animals with a loan from Kashf Foundation.

Zarina is 43 years old and married. She buys animals, such as baby goats and calves, at low prices, and then raises and sells them in the market at a profit. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income.

Zarina needs to improve her business so she can cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely both expand her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Norijon

texts.en:
Norijon was born in 1959. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is a kind man and he is a master of repairing houses.

Norijon works in a local school of her region. She is a cleaning woman. Norijon has worked here for many years and her colleagues respect her because she is very hardworking woman. Norijon also has additional income from buying and selling dried fruits.

Norijon now needs financial support because she is ill. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy medicines for treatment for herself. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment for herself.

loans.name: Akhteri

texts.en:
Akhteri is a 49-year-old vigorous, married woman. For many years, she has been running her tailoring and hand-embroidery business. She is skilled in the art of both making beautiful embroidery patterns and stitching fine clothing. She is well-known on her street, and she is her household's best earning resource.

Akhteri is a mother of 7 children. She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR in order to buy raw materials in large quantities such as thread, sequins, and pearls. She will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand of her customers.

Akhteri hopes to earn more profits so she can fulfill her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in large quantities such as thread, sequins, and pearls so she can consistently meet increasing customer demand.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a married woman who runs a toy shop along with her husband. She is a very hardworking lady.

Yasmeen earns enough money to support her family. She has 5 children, and she is responsible for bearing the cost of their education, food, and clothing.

Yasmeen needs to expand her business, so she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR in order to buy more toys such as games, toy cars, balls, etc. An increased inventory would attract more children to her shop, helping her earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more toys such as games, toy cars, balls, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a widowed mother of two children, both of whom do not attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothing sales business, selling on a retail basis to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of high cost of transportation and competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

Christine decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 40,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Phu

texts.en: Mrs. Phu is 22 years old. She is married and has two children, and all of them are schooling. She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living conditions and health of her family. Her income is mainly from a small business, so she has regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 45-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and manages the entire household. He has been running his own business as a rice wholesaler for the past 10 years. He needs to buy rice bags in bulk and other commodities for reselling purposes, but due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these commodities.

Therefore, Mumtaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her husband to buy these commodities for reselling purposes to earn a maximum profitable income. This profitable income will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of the family and business. Mumtaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his rice wholesale business.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children, all of whom have a job. She works very hard to feed and educate her children.

Mrs. Van would like to improve her family’s standard of living, especially her children, but she lacks the capital. This loan will help her to build a sanitary latrine. She will be able to repay the loan from income earned from animal husbandry.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a 28-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. He wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, teabags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all the above products for reselling purposes.

Therefore, Tina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn a maximum profitable income, to manage his household and business. Tina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his general store business.

loans.name: Yudy

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Yudy, one of Ruma's agents. He lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only child. He owns a stall where daily he sells consumer products, and now he also provides mobile airtime credits for his community.

Yudy has been a Ruma agent since 2014. He feels that since he joined Ruma he has learned a lot about how to improve his business and how to find other business opportunities, as well contribute more to his community.

As his business keeps growing, Yudy hopes to take a working capital loan from Kiva's lenders. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his customers, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful in helping Yudy improve his business and, accordingly, his community who needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Yudy is sitting in his own stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Rustico

texts.en:
