Rustico is 51 years old, married, and he and his family live in Buntun. He sustains his family's needs by providing motorcycle transport services to the people in his village.

Rustico wants to continue improving his services which is why he is now asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to use for his motorcycle. He will buy tires, oil, and gasoline for motorcycle maintenance.

Rustico will save additional revenue for emergency purposes and reinvesting in his business. He also promises to repay his loan in full and keep providing safe travel to all of his passengers.

loans.use: to buy tires, oil, and gasoline for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Zodelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zodelis Del Carmen es estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para cubrir sus gastos educativos. Esta es su historia: 
Mi nombre es Zodelis,  vivo en salcedo con mis  padres,  mi padre es Agrónomo  y mi madre ama de casa.  Tengo  dos hermanos, estudio medicina en la Universidad  Nordestana  (San Francisco de Macorís ).   Elegí  Medicina 
Porque  me gusta y es muy gratificante ya que no hay mayor satisfacción que 
ayudar a los demás (servir ), porque  nunca dejas de aprender cosas nuevas , 
y lo sorprendente y maravilloso  que puede ser el cuerpo y nuestra mente. 
Para mí es la mejor carrera que pude elegir, me encanta.
Mi familia  no cuenta con el dinero suficiente  para costearme  la universidad  
ya que somos una familia humilde hasta hora han hecho un esfuerzos  sobre  
humano para sacarnos adelante, por lo que me veo en la necesidad de solicitar un   crédito  para poder continuar estudiando. 
Soy una persona muy aplicada y estudiosa que quiere salir adelante y sacar 
adelante mi familia  y sé que con Dios por delante lo lograre, porque  el que se 
esfuerza cada día, lucha , persevera y logra sus metas . No importa los obstáculos que se me presenten en el camino porque  yo los voy  a vencer y sí  me caigo  me levantaré  con mas fuerzas por  mi familia  y por  mí. 
Porque  quiero ser alguien  en el mañana y sé que lo lograre con esfuerzo y
 dedicación.
texts.en:
Zodelis Del Carmen is studying medicine.  She is requesting a loan to cover her educational expenses.  This is her story:

My name is Zodelis.  I live in Salcedo with my parents.  My father is an agronomist and my mother is a housewife.  I have 2 siblings.  I am studying medicine in the Nordestana University (San Francisco de Macorís ). I chose medicine because I like it and because it is very rewarding, as there is no better satisfaction than helping others (to serve).  Also, I never stop learning new things, and things that are surprising and marvelous about the human body and mind.  For me, this is the best career that I could choose, as I love it.  

My family does not have enough money to pay for my university expenses because we are a poor family, but they have made super-human efforts to help me to get ahead.  This is why I have seen the need to request a loan so that I can continue with my education.  

I am a very diligent and studious person who wants to get ahead and provide for my family, and I know that with God at my side I will achieve this, because those who exert themselves every day, fight, and persevere, will achieve their goals. The obstacles that I encounter on my path won't matter, because I will surmount them, and if I fall I will get up with even more strength for my family and for me.  This is because I want to become someone in the future, and I know that I can do it with effort and dedication.

loans.use: to pay for higher education expenses

loans.name: Apriyanti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Apriyanti, one of Ruma's agents. Apriyanti lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and two sons. She owns a stall where she sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for her community. She already joined Ruma in 2014. She feels that since she joined Ruma, she has learned a lot about how to improve her business and how to manage another business opportunity, as well as give more contribution to her community.

As the business keeps growing, Apriyanti is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Apriyanti improve her business, and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Apriyanti is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van is 41 years old. She is married and has 6 children, 4 of whom have jobs.

Mrs. Van would like to take this loan in order to build a latrine, which will help improve her family's living conditions and health.

Mrs. Van's income comes mainly from animal husbandry and fishing, so she have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 38-year-old, hardworking woman who has two children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Yasmeen ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years she has established a good clientele.

Yasmeen has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces, for consistently meeting the demands of her customers. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces, for consistently meeting the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy is a hardworking woman who is 52 years old. She lives with her husband and her children in a small house that does not have a hygienic latrine.

This loan will help Mrs. Thuy to build a latrine to improve her family's standard of living. Her family’s income comes mainly from cultivation and animal husbandry, so she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en:
Mrs. Dao is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a rural area and raising poultry and cattle is her main job, which she has been doing for more than 15 years.

This loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine in order to improve her living standard, especially for her children.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Maisha Zakhem Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her early thirties, is a divorcee with four children; two of them are big and one of them is still small and one is still in school. She has been running two projects selling fruits, vegetables, and fried fish for six years now. She works from 6:00am to 7.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the fruits and vegetables (kiswahili genge) and started selling fried fish. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.

She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profits to pay school fees and bought a plot of land, built her house, bought a TV set, a sofa set, a radio and cupboards, covered household expenses, and repaid the loans. She will use this loan to restore the out of stock items in the genge store and to increase the fish stock. She dreams of expanding her business.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group Maisha Zakhem which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restore the out of stock items in the genge store and to increase the fish stock.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong is 42 years old, married and has two children. She works hard to support her family.

She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially for her children, but lacks capital. The loan will help her to build a sanitary latrine, and she will able to repay the loan from selling chickens, ducks, pigs and vegetables.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa, de 47 años de edad, solo estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, su esposo es albañil y tienen 3 hijos pero solo uno vive con ellos. 

Rosa, tiene una tienda desde hace más de diez años, este pequeño negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su esposo y ahora es su principal fuente de ingresos.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan y detergentes, de esta manera mejorara su pequeña tienda y tendrá más productos para ofrecer.	

Rosa, sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y que su hijo se supere académicamente.
texts.en:
Rosa, 47 years old, only studied until the ninth grade. She is married. Her husband is a builder and they have three children, but only one lives with them.

Rosa has had a store for over ten years. She started this small business with the help of her husband and now it is their main source of income.

Rosa needs the loan to buy more products such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, and detergent. In this way, she will improve her small store and have more products to offer.

Rosa dreams of improving her quality of life and that her son betters himself academically.

loans.use: to buy more products such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, and detergent to improve her small store.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 34-year-old, married lady woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to boost her earnings, and wishes to spend it on providing quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to boost her earnings.

loans.name: Kiambani Strikers Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Agnetta. She is 30 years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from all the training, especially in enterprise development and financial management.

She is a businesswoman dealing with the selling of clothes. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to add stock in her cloth-selling business so that she can meet her customers' demands, hence increasing her income. She says that this will help her provide better food for her family and pay education fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the support given.

loans.use: to add stock to her cloth-selling business and meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Mrs. Lien is a farmer who is 32 years old and married. She has three children under 18 years of age.

She would like to improve her living standards, especially for her children, but lacks capital. The loan will help her to build a hygienic latrine. Farming is the main income source of her family, and she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Aman is a freshman in the Software Engineering Program at AUCA. To realize his goals, he came to study to Bishkek from Issyk-Kul region. His region is famous among the tourists to Kyrgyzstan thanks to the Issyk-Kul Lake, which is translated into English as a “warm lake” due to the fact that it doesn’t freeze in winter.

Aman was brought up by his grandparents. Unfortunately, last year he lost his grandfather and is now lives with his grandmother. His grandmother is a pensioner and gets a pension from the state. However, pensions in Kyrgyzstan are too little to support them both.

As their region is a resort for tourists during the summer and fall, Aman’s grandmother earns money renting rooms, so their income depends on the high season and good weather. Aman does his best to help his grandmother during the summer and is happy to have her in his life.

It was a difficult decision for Aman to leave his grandmother and move to Bishkek to study at AUCA. When his grandmother heard about his idea, she didn’t just support it, but said that she would do her best to cover part of the tuition, if he got financial aid from the university. As he hoped, AUCA provided partial financial aid to Aman and now he is applying for a Kiva loan to get more aid.

He thanks Kiva lenders for the given chance and assures you that your investment in him will change him and his family’s life for the better.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Utethio Wa Aka Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Lucia. She is a 63-year-old lady, married and blessed with two children. She is a member of Utethio Wa Aka group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014, and has undergone training on enterprise and financial management. The group members mainly run a green grocery.

She has a green grocery and she is borrowing from Kiva to buy more kale, bananas, tomatoes and cabbages. This will increase sales leading to a rise in her income. She will thus be in a position to provide basic needs such as food and clothing to her family. Lucia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promise to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more kale, ripe bananas, tomatoes and cabbages. This will increase sales leading to a rise in her income.

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Bora is a 20-year-old freshman at a university pursuing architecture and engineering in the city. He is from the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia.

Due to a lack of financial support, Bora would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees from the first to the fifth year. This loan will help him graduate successfully and achieve his dreams.

In the future, he is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary, so he will be able to have enough money to help his parents.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees from the first to the fifth year.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is a 19-year-old freshman taking the building-decoration architecture major at university in a city. He is from Kampot Province of Cambodia.

Because he is short of finances to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fifth year, he would like to request a loan. With the loan, Sopheap will be able to graduate successfully and find a job to build his future.

After graduation, Sopheap wants to work in a company with reasonable salary. He also wants to build a new house for his family and if he gets children he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor or master degrees if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fifth year.

loans.name: Tania Gladys

texts.es:
La socia Tania continua  dedicándose a elaborar y vender panes chutas en el distrito de Oropesa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener mas ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito nuevo para comprar azúcar, harina entre otros.
 La socia esta agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota de una manera disciplinada.
texts.en:
Tania continues to work making and selling chuta bread in the district of Oropesa. She has had this business for a long time, which is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business each day. She is a determined and enterprising woman who hopes to obtain more earnings through her business and in this way continue supporting her family.

Tania requests a new loan to buy sugar, flour, and other items.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Haneefa

texts.en:
Haneefa is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop.

Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and they make enough to meet the expenses of their four children.

Currently, she is requesting a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to cater to maximum customers in order to generate a healthier source of income.

She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to cater to maximum customers in order to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en:
Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Rasoolan to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Rasoolan is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of 3 children.

In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
It was hard for Shagufta to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. She is a 43-year-old married woman, and a mother of three children. Some years ago she started her business, selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to sell in the market. Shagufta has gained great confidence in the business, as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to sell in the market.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Day-by-day increasing expenditures compelled Noor to initiate her own business, selling animals. She is a 47-year-old married woman, doing business with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of seven children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

She has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu is 41 years old, and she is a widow. She lives with her children.

The loan will help her to build a sanitary latrine, which can contribute to improving the health of her family as well as environmental protection. Husbandry and small business are the main income sources of her family, so she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of 4 children.

She has been doing a business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household along with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business.

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time.

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Anwar hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting orders on time.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community.

She has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also sells fabric material to the people of her town. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a new stitching machine, along with spools of threads in different colors, to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine, along with spools of threads in different colors, to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Reena

texts.en:
Reena is a 33-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Reena is also providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute to her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Reena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 46-year-old married lady, who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Shamim makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates, to make her stock available for her customers. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Shamim wishes to utilize part of her revenues for providing a good, quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates, to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 40-year-old married woman. She is living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is doing embroidery work by her hands at home and financially supporting her family. She belongs to a poor family and her husband’s income is very poor, so she decided to start embroidery work at home.

She learned this art in her childhood, and now she adopted it for her occupation. She enabled herself to become independent and earn a sufficient income.

Nasreen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase stocks of threads, silk, fancy, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of threads, silk, fancy, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Umar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Umar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Umar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Umar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Umar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María, de 41 años de edad, solo estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, no tiene hijos y su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de tejas de barro.

María, se dedica a comercializar verduras en su comunidad, ella sale a vender casa por casa desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, este negocio lo inició junto a su hermana mayor y le ha generado buenos ingresos.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar más verduras para vender e incrementar sus ganancias. 


María, sueña con que su negocio crezca y poder tener hijos.
texts.en:
María, 41 years old, only studied until the ninth grade. She is married and does not have children. Her husband works making clay tiles.

María works selling vegetables in her community. She has gone out to sell house by house for approximately the last five years. She started this business together with her older sister and it has generated good income for her.

María needs the loan to buy more vegetables to sell and increase her earnings.

María dreams of her business growing and being able to have children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell and increase her earnings.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 48 years old with seven children; the oldest is 32 and the youngest is 18.

She helps her husband, a home tools vendor, in supporting their daily expenses through her sari-sari store (small grocery store). She sells candies, biscuits, coffee, and other items to generate more income for her family.

She wanted to add other items to increase her income since the holiday is near approaching , so she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 17,000 to buy two dozen boxes of instant coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and other additional items to sell in her store.

Mary Ann wanted to expand her store more and add shelves for her stocks to help more for her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy two dozen boxes of instant coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and other additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her six children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Saima is also providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute to her husband to manage the household.

She needs to purchase a sewing machine for tailoring purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase a sewing machine. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will enable her to purchase the above-mentioned sewing machine and also will be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Saima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for tailoring purposes.

loans.name: Iroda

texts.en:
Iroda was born in the year 1980. She is a woman with a kind heart who lives with her husband and three children in a village. They live together happily and always try to improve their living standards.

She has had her own business for more than six years. She has been busy with animal husbandry. She feeds cows and sheep, and, after feeding them for some months, sells them in a local market. She also sells milk and milk products.

Iroda little by little improves her living conditions. Now she builds a new house. She must make a roof for her house before winter but she has no money for it. She is asking for a loan of 13,000 TJS to buy wood and slate for making the roof of her new house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy wood and slate for making the roof of her new house.

loans.name: Mukwe

texts.en:
Mukwe is 44 years old. He is married with four children. He has had a livestock business for 10 years.

He will be using the loan to purchase cattle and hopes this will help him to boost business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a better business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to help him to boost business

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is a married mother of four children, two of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from a retail shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of the high cost of transportation and competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of new  clothes for resale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 33 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3,000 loan through GDMPC to purchase groceries and items to sell, like noodles, chips, bread, canned goods, soap, shampoo, etc. She has been in this business for one year.

In the future Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Brayan Santiago

texts.es: Santiago tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su tía, es muy emprendedor y responsable, hace tres años gracias a un pequeño crédito que lo invirtió en comprar ropa  para vender en lugares muy alejados e incluso llega a zonas donde los clientes no pueden salir a comprar  al mercado por la falta de transporte, Con las ganancias de este negocio estudia por las noches,  desea superarse diariamente. Santiago con el dinero  comprara mercadería para poder surtir su negocio, llegar a más clientes obtener mayores ingresos para podes satisfacer alimentación y educación.
texts.en:
Santiago is 21 years old, single and lives with his aunt. He is very entrepreneurial and responsible. Three years ago, thanks to a small loan, he invested in buying clothes to sell in places that were very far away, even in areas where customers can't go to the market due to lack of transportation. With the money he makes from this business he studies in the evenings. He wants to improve himself every day. 

With the money Santiago will buy merchandise to stock his business, reach more customers and make a better income in order to pay for his food and school.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock the business.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia Yanet continua con su negocio de  tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo  varias cosas como ropa, lana, libros entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar libros entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Yanet has continued her grocery store business. She is a hard working and entrepreneurial woman who hopes to make more profits through her business in order to support her family. She still sells a variety of clothes things like clothes, wool and books, among other things that her customers ask for. She hopes to be able to continue working to continue supporting her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy books and other things. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy books and other things.

loans.name: Jose Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín, de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado, su esposa le ayuda en su taller de hamacas y también realiza oficios domésticos en su casa; su hija mayor vive cerca de él pero tiene su propia familia.

Agustín, se dedica a la elaboración de hamaca y lazos de hilo, los cuales hace en su casa por pedidos desde hace muchos años.- Agustín, vende un promedio mensual de 5 hamacas y elabora 10 docenas de lazos a la semana; su esposa le ayuda en la elaborar de dichos productos, los cuales venden en la ciudad que está a 30 kilómetros de su casa.

Agustin, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para su negocio como conos de hilos, argollas y cañamos; con los cuales espera cumplir con los pedidos que le han hecho y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos.
 
Agustin, sueña con tener una vivienda digna, cómoda y segura para su familia y brindarles todo lo necesario para su bienestar.
texts.en:
Agustin, 65 years old, studied up to second grade and is married. His wife helps in his hammock workshop and is also a housewife. His oldest daugther lives near him but she has her own family. Agustin makes a living producing hammocks and ties, which he has made in his home on order for many years. 

Agustin sells a monthly average of 5 hammocks and he makes 10 dozen ties a week. His wife helps him make these products, which they sell in the city 30 km from their home. 

Agustin needs the loan to buy materials for his business such as spools of thread, rings and hemp, which he hopes to use to fulfill the placed orders and improve his income. Agustin dreams of having a respectable home, comfortable and safe for his family and of giving them everything they need for their well being.

loans.use: to buy materials for his business such as spools of thread, rings and hemp.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Mrs. Dao is 42 years old, married and lives with her two children. She has been working in a small business for more than 15 years. She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the living conditions and health of her family, especially her children, and also contribute to environment protection.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Leydi Marilin

texts.es:
La socia Leydi  continua con su negocio de productos de belleza, la socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo colonias, perfumes entre otros entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de perfumes para mujeres.
texts.en: Member Leydi has continued with her beauty product business. She is a hard working and entrepreneurial woman who hopes to make more profits through her business in order to support her family. She still sells cologne, perfume and other things that her customers ask for. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments. She wants to continue working to support her family. She is requesting the loan to buy women's perfumes.

loans.use: to buy women's perfumes.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina, de 66 años de edad, no estudio, es madre soltera y solo tiene una hija que ya tiene se casó
 
Faustina, por las mañanas trabaja en un hotel lavando ropa y haciendo limpieza y en la tarde elabora panes con pollo en su casa para vender todos los días.
 
Faustina, necesita el préstamo para comprar pan, pollo, repollo, salsas, verduras, bolsas, entre otros insumos que ocupa para preparar los panes.

El sueño de Faustina, es ayudarle a sus dos nietos para que estudien y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Faustina, 66 years old, doesn't study, she is a single mother and only has one daughter. In the morning she works at a hotel washing clothes and cleaning and in the afternoon she makes bread with chicken at her home to sell every day. 

Faustina needs the loan to buy bread, chicken, cabbage, sauces, vegetables, bags and other supplies to make the sandwiches. Faustina's dream is to help her two grandchildren to go to school and become working professionals.

loans.use: to buy bread, chicken, cabbage, sauces, vegetables, bags and other supplies to make the sandwiches.

loans.name: Flor De Naranja Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FLOR DE NARANJA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de la Convencion y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gladys ,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo trigo, cebada  entre otros entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cebada,kinua entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers are members of the communal bank "Flor de Naranja", or "Flower of the Orange". This group is located in the Huayopata district which is located in the Convención province in the department of Cusco. 
One of these borrowers is Gladys, who continues selling cereals. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who hopes to earn a greater income through her business, and in this way to continue supporting her family. 
She continues selling wheat, barley and other cereals to the customers who request it from her. She remains grateful for the loan and she promises to comply with her scheduled payments. Gladys hopes to be able to continue working and supporting her family. 
She requests this loan to purchase barley and quinoa, among other things. 
The members of this loan group are grateful to those who help make this dream a reality through this platform, and they promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase barley and quinoa.

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en:
Saleema is a 59 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and manages the entire household. 

One of her sons has been running his own business as a rice whole seller for the past 2 years. Saleema's son needs to buy rice bags in bulk and other commodities for reselling purposes, but due to financial constraints, her son is unable to purchase these commodities. Therefore Saleema has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her son to buy these commodities for reselling purposes to earn maximum profitable income. This profitable income will also help him make savings to meet the needs of his family and business.

Saleema is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son increase his rice wholesale business.

loans.name: Ma. Wilma

texts.en:
Ma. Wilma is 48 years old, married with 6 children. The oldest is 21 years old and the youngest is 8 years old. She operates her sari-sari store (small grocery store) to help her husband with their family expenses and also with the school expenses of her children. She wants to see her children finish their schooling so she works hard from 6 am up to 11 pm.

Ma. Wilma wanted to expand her store because the location is in front of the street and has regular customers. Ma. Wilma is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 17,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, and other items to sell in her store. Ma. Wilma hopes to expand her store to help her family more, not just with their expenses but with the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Agnus

texts.en: Agnus is a hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a business selling blankets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good collection to offer and has attained a regular list of customers. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy bundles of blankets and bedspreads in different colors and designs. It will help her inflate her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of blankets and bedspreads in different colors

loans.name: Reina Suyapa

texts.es: Reina, de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en una de las aldeas de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta básica donde ofrece productos como refrescos, pan, maíz, frijoles, café, golosinas, embutidos y otros abarrotes de primera necesidad. Esta pulpería la tiene desde hace 3 años en su casa y cuenta con buena clientela. Mientras su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo con ODEF y es por la cantidad de 25,000 Lempiras que invertirá en comprar productos para surtir su pulpería como ser aceite, azúcar, arroz, pan, huevos, pastas, harina  de maiz, condimentos, verduras, churros, refrescos y productos de limpieza. Esto le ayudara a tener un mejor inventario que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos. Su meta es ayudar a su familia a progresar,aumentar y fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Reina is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and son in one of the neighborhoods of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. She has a business selling basic everyday products such as snacks, bread, corn, beans, coffee, sodas, cold cuts and other basic items. 
Reina has run this grocery store, or "pulpería", for the past 3 years out of her home, and she has a good customer base. Her husband works in agriculture.
The loan she has requested will be her second loan cycle with ODEF, and it is for the amount of 25,000 Lempiras which she will invest in products to stock her store. These products include oil, sugar, rice, bread, eggs, pasta, cornmeal, condiments, vegetables, churros, snacks and cleaning products. This will help her to have a greater inventory which will permit her to increase her earnings.
Reina's goal is to help her family progress, and to strengthen and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a hard working mother of two, who has been working in Mouneh (traditional Lebanese pickled food) production and sales for ten years to support her husband who works with a low income business in covering their family's increasing living needs.
Dalal's business income is invested in covering her family's daily living needs, thus an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, will be used to support her beloved husband in paying for their children's school tuition fees.
She will work hard to develop her Mouneh production business through diversifying her products.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old. She is married and she is a businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of secondhand clothes. Maria has been involved in business activities since a few years ago. She started with her own working capital.

She is earning a good income from selling at her business because she is selling in the center of the market, so many people like to shop there and she is still happy to do her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more secondhand clothes such as short sleeved and long sleeved shirts, trousers, shorts, skirts and other things.

loans.use: to buy short and long sleeved shirts, trousers, shorts, skirts and other things.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 51 year old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small canteen with her husband. She has become popular on her street and earns good amount of income. She is a mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 45000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: o buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently

loans.name: Karla Stefany

texts.es: Karla tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con su madre y sus 2 hermanas María de 16 y Antonela de 6 años de edad ellas estudian en unidades educativas del sector, es alegre y muy trabajadora  empezó a vender pantalones, puerta a puerta visita a sus clientes ofertándoles nuevos modelos, diseños, colores la forma de cobro de esta mercadería es por partes. Karla necesita el dinero para comprar mercadería incrementaría sus ventas e ingresos ayudaría a su madre con los gastos del hogar y podría seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Karla is 20 years old and single. She lives with her mother and her two sisters, Maria, who is 16, and Antonela, who is 6. They go to school in educational units of the sector.

Karla is cheerful and very hard working. She started to sell pants door to door and visits her clients offering them new styles, designs, and colors. The merchandise is charged in installments.

Karla needs the money to buy merchandise. It would increase her sales and income, help her mother with the household expenses, and Karla would be able to continue going to school.

loans.use: to buy pants to stock her business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 31 years old, married to Duncan, and blessed with two children aged 14 and 16 years. She has been involved in the business of selling new clothes for two years now and she earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

This being her third loan with Vision Fund Kenya, she intends to purchase a motorcycle for transport and hopes this will improve her income and way of living.

She plans to use the increased business profits to help her husband in paying school fees for their children. Her hopes and dreams are to become financially stable and to lead a prosperous life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a responsible mother of 2 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for 5 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because it is not currently in good condition: it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis.

Due to their insufficient finances, her husband is unable to conduct the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shazia's husband will easily be able to afford the maintenance costs and provide better transportation services to earn profitable income. Shazia also plans to put the profits of her husband's income into savings, to meet her family's needs in the future.

Shazia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's taxi

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
A local resident living in a rural area of Stoeng Sen district of Kampong Thom province, Chi is a 58-year-old woman and the married mother of eight children, two of whom are schoolchildren and need her support in their studies. The primary source of her income is from growing rice and she has been catching fish to get additional income to improve her living. The farming business has been threatened by flood.

For Chi, she has never been with VisionFund and this is the first time for her. Through this loan, she is going to pay for school fees for her daughter. She hopes to earn more income to keep buying school supplies and she hopes that her daughter can graduate with a good paying job.

loans.use: To pay for school fees for her daughter.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 43 years old, married to David, and blessed with three children aged 24, 22 and 19 years old. She has been in the dairy and tea seedlings businesses for five years and earns a monthly income of KES 26,000.

This is her fourth loan with Vision Fund Kenya, having cleared the previous loans successfully. With this loan she intends to pay school fees for her son at Moi university.

She hopes and dreams of owning a Matatu, which would help her transport her goods to nearby markets in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for the sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Liquisa. She is married and she has one child. A $1000 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She is a businesswoman and her business is sewing pillows. She will buy some materials with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin, such as cotton, fabric and sewing needles.

She has been involving herself in business activities since a few years ago, with her own working capital. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can help her husband to be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy cotton, fabric and sewing needles.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, a farmer living in a one-bedroom house located in Kampong Thom province, is a 40-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are in school. To make a living, she has been growing rice to support her family's condition for years. She has been selling snacks to earn more income too. Her daily income is around 10 USD per day and she can save about 3 USD each day after expenses. Unfortunately, her rice has been threatened by drought, which is the main challenge for her farmland.

This is the second loan for her. The past loan, which was completely repaid, has enabled her to improve her living. Now, she is applying for a new loan with VisionFund to pay for school fees for her son. She hopes to earn more income to keep her children in school until graduating and she also hopes to see her son has a bright future.

loans.use: To pay for school fees for her son.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 43-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial situation, so she started a business selling cloth. She believes that, through her business, she can earn some respect, make a better world for her children and help with their education.

Tahira is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently, she needs a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 42 years old and married with six children. For many years she has been running a business selling milk with the help of her husband.

She has buffaloes for milking and then she sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken out many loans from Kashf Foundation and now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales

loans.name: Maridalia

texts.es:
Maridalia es estudiante de Odontologia, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos. Esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Maridalia, tengo 22 años de edad, vivo con mi madre y soy estudiante de odontología, en Utesa Santiago.  No estoy trabajando ya que mi carrera ocupa la mayor parte de mi tiempo. 
He escogido esta carrera porque  desde pequeña me ha gustado mucho la labor que realiza un odontólogo, dentro de las materias que me gustan están: Biología y anatomía.  Necesito el préstamo ya que mi madre no cuenta con los ingresos para costearme los mismos, de no lograrlo tendría que dejar la Universidad.
 Este préstamo es muy importante para mí, porque con el podré tener la oportunidad de terminar mi carrera y ser una buena odontóloga. 
Dentro de mis metas está, hacer operativos para ayudar a los más necesitados, tener mi consultorio y poder desarrollarme como profesional.
texts.en:
Maridalia is a dentistry student. She is asking for a loan in order to be able to cover her educational expenses.

This is her story: "My name is Maridalia. I am 22 years old and I live with my mother. I am a dentistry student in Utesa Santiago. I'm not working since my studies take up most of my time. I chose this career because since I was young I have liked the work that dentists do. Among the subjects that interest me are biology and anatomy. I need the loan because my mother doesn't have the means to pay for my expenses. If I don't get it I will have to stop going to college. This loan is very important to me because with it I will have the opportunity to finish my studies and be a good dentist. Among my goals are to perform operations to help those in need, to have my own practice, and to develop myself as a professional."

loans.use: to cover her higher education costs.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a married woman and wants to support her husband financially. The man shown in the photo is Khadija ’s husband. They have been running a shoe-making business for many years and count a good client list. Khadija needs to increase sales to fulfill the basic needs of the family. Currently, she has requested for a 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as leather, plastic leather, polishes etc to increase production. In this way her husband would be able to increase his sales and earn more income. He intends to utilize part of the profits on his family's betterment and well-being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather, plastic leather, polishes etc to increase production

loans.name: Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion De Pantorrilla Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE PANTORRILLA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yanatile, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Graciela  sigue  dedicándose al cultivo de frutas como plátanos entre otros, la socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo fruta para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes.
Los demás socios se dedican a la cultivo de hortalizas, cultivo de frutas, cultivo de cereales, tienda de abarrotes.
Los socios en general agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the "Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion de Pantorrilla" communal bank, which is located in the Yanatile district in the Calca province in the department of Cusco.

Graciela continues working growing fruit, such as bananas, among others. She is a persevering and entrepreneurial woman who hopes to obtain more income through her business and thus be able to continue supporting her family.

She continues selling fruit to her customers who ask for it. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to follow through with the payments on her loan. She wants to keep working in order to continue helping her family.

Graciela is requesting the loan to purchase manure and fertilizers.

The other group members work growing vegetables, fruit and grain, and have grocery stores. They are grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform and they promise to make payments on what they owe within the established timelines.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 22-year-old green grocer at Mikindani, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single lady who has been in operation for the last two years, earning a good income.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase tomatoes, green bananas, cabbages, kale, and fruits in her food stall, and the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to have a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, green bananas, cabbages, kale, and fruits.

loans.name: Azmat

texts.en:
Azmat is a 57-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her son has been running a general store for the past year. Her son is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Azmat's son wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints her son is not in a suitable position to buy all the above products for reselling purposes.

Therefore Azmat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.

Azmat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy commodities for her son for his general store.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 46-year-old married woman with 3 children. She is a hardworking lady and, for the past many years, has been running a business selling clothes.

She buys a collection of dresses from the wholesale market and then sells it to the people of her town at a profit. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR  to buy a new collection of dresses to meet customers' demands on time. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

With the loan, Razia expects a boost in her earnings, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of dresses to meet customers' demands on time.

loans.name: Mukhtiaran

texts.en:
Mukhtiaran is a 49-year-old married woman. She has six children.

She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics and in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Mukhtiaran expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Sania

texts.en:
Sania is a 33-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the family's needs. Sania is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband's to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy a sewing machine and other accessories for her business purposes but, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Sania is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and accessories for her tailoring business

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 31 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 10 years, her husband is only responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Saima's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of clothes, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable condition to buy above these items for his business. Therefore Saima has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn more profitable income.

For the financial assistance Saima is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help Saima's husband increase his tailoring business by buying different types of tailoring accessories

loans.name: Yawo

texts.en:
Yawo is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yawo is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yawo would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yawo will store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Yawo now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
Agusta has been involved in business activities since a few years ago. She started with her own working capital. Now she is requesting a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She has come to the age of 30, but she is not too dependent on her husband.

She has a kiosk in front of her house and she taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use it to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including cooking oil, noodles, eggs, sardines, hand and body lotion, milk, biscuits, ketchup, sauces, lighters, candies, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She said she will improve her management with the loan that is being offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, noodles, eggs, sardines, hand and body lotion, milk, biscuits, ketchup, sauces, lighters, candies, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Rawiya

texts.en: Rawiya is a 25-year-old married woman living with her husband. She is the mother of two children who are still attending school. Her husband works as a taxi driver and is the main source of income for the family. Today she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay her children's educational fees. This is her first loan, but she said that she will be a permanent client and is eager to request additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Blessed Mothers Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand is Robert, a member of Blessed Mothers Women Group. He is 43 years old, married and blessed with eight children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped him improve his knowledge in business management. His economic activity is goat rearing and farming potatoes and maize. He needs a loan from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. This will increase his sales and will help to expand his enterprise. He hopes for an increment in income, thus enabling him to continue supporting his family.

Robert is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support, and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. This will increase his sales and will help to expand his enterprise.

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en:
Shanaz is a 41-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of crockery sales for many years. She sells various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. Her husband (also shown in the photo) assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in the local market.

She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income. In order to improve her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. The loan will enable her to purchase a wider variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 52-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes.

She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Tasleem is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list.

Currently she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 42-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and two children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 10 years. Her husband alone is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Maryam's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g., pieces of cloth, lace, needles, and sewing machine accessories. Due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in suitable condition to buy the above items for his business purposes.

Therefore Maryam has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Maryam is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his tailoring business.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 44-year-old married mother of six who has been working as a tailor for two years to support her husband in covering their beloved family's living expenses.

Wafaa is working hard to develop her business and improve the quality of work she does.
Her acquired income combined with her husband's is barely enough to cover the needs of eight family members.

Thus, to improve her business she is requesting support form an external financial supporter which is represented today by Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. Through her acquired loan, Wafaa will buy necessary tailoring needs such as needles, threads, fabrics and updated tools to develop her business.

She hopes to stay capable of improving and developing her business in a well-managed way.

loans.use: To buy necessary tailoring needs such as needles, threads, fabrics and updated tools to develop her business

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a hardworking 24-year-old single lady who graduated from her vocational college and established her own beauty salon in 2010.

Zeina is very talented in her domain. She is passionate about her work and believes that she can show beauty in every lady who puts trust in her provided services.

To keep her customers pleased, she works hard to develop her business to stay up to date with every beauty-related release.

She is working hard to develop her business and requests financial support. Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua was her solution. Through an acquired Youth loan, Zeina will buy updated beauty services for her business with newly-released tools and winter cosmetics.

She hopes to expand and increase her working services to reply to her customers' requests.

loans.use: To buy updated beauty services for her business with newly-released tools and winter cosmetics.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassanis is a 25-year-old married father of one. He is an employee with a limited salary but he is working hard to improve his family's standard of living. Ali is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition.

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options.

Hassan hopes to continue supporting his children's education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for his child's school tuition and make sure he can continue his education

loans.name: Emeliza Andrea

texts.es: Emeliza es una joven madre que reside en compañía de su cónyuge y su hijo de 1 año de edad en un humilde barrio de Cartagena, ella desde su vivienda comercializa bebidas, labor que heredó de su abuela quien antes de fallecer le cedió el negocio.  Su negocio es muy conocido en el vecindario al ser un negocio que cuenta con un tiempo de funcionamiento de 5 años, sin contar con el tiempo de su antigua propietaria.  En su refrigerador botellero maneja un amplio surtido de gaseosas, jugos naturales y cervezas que sus clientes pueden comprar en cualquier momento del día. Como se está acercando una temporada de fiestas, Emeliza, realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para mejorar sus inventarios de gaseosas, jugos y cervezas e incrementar sus ventas.  A futuro los deseos de Emeliza son tener un punto frio, es decir una distribuidora de cervezas y continuar con la crianza de su hijo.
texts.en:
Emeliza is a young mother who lives with her spouse and her one year old son in a poor neighborhood of Cartagena. From her house she sells drinks, work that she inherited from her grandmother who gave her the business before she died. Her business is well known in her neighborhood as it is a business that has been functioning for 5 years, not counting the time with the former owner. In her drink cooler she manages an ample assortment of soft drinks, natural juices and beer that her clients can purchase at any time of the day.

As the festive season is approaching Emeliza is applying for a loan from Kiva, an opportunity to access the financial world through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to improve her inventory of soft drinks, juice and beer to increase her sales. In the future her desire is to have a cold sales location, that is become a distributor of beer and continue to raise her son.

loans.use: to improve her inventory of soft drinks, juice and beer to increase her sales.

loans.name: Wendy Edith

texts.es:
Wendy, de 22 años de edad, solo estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos pequeños y solo uno va a la escuela y el otro lo cuida su madre.

Wendy, tiene varios años de vender refrescos, tostadas, frutas y verduras junto a su hermana, ella se dedico a vender este tipo de productos por la necesidad de que sus hijos tuvieran lo necesario para vivir, ella se levanta todos los días a las 4:00 a.m. para ir a comprar al mercado lo que necesita para la venta.
 
Wendy, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como: rinso, jabón y para comprar ropa, porque se acerca la temporada de diciembre y es cuando más producto vende, de esa forma tendrá más ingresos y tendrá una mejor calidad de vida para ella y sus hijos.

El sueño de Wendy, es tener un puesto más grande y vender otro tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Wendy is 22 years old. She only studied through the sixth grade. She is a single mother and has two small children, one of whom goes to school, and the other stays with his mother.
Alongside her sister, Wendy has been selling snacks, sandwiches, fruits and vegetables for a few years now. She began selling these products because her children needed her to support them. She gets up every morning at 4:00 a.m. to go to the market to purchase what she will sell.
She needs this loan to purchase merchandise such as detergent and soap, and also to purchase clothing, because the December season is approaching and that is when she sells the most clothing. In this way, she will have a greater income and will be able to have a better quality of life for her children. 
Wendy's dream is to have a larger stall and to sell new types of products.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as detergent, soap and clothing.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, de 44 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja de empleado en una alcaldía y tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad.

Candelaria, desde hace ocho años se ha dedicado a vender tortillas, ella inicio el negocio debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia.
 
Candelaria, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y leña en grandes cantidades, para comprar más barato y de esa manera cubrir sus necesidades y continuar con su negocio. 

El sueño de Candelaria, es mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar su vivienda con los ingresos que consigue de su venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Candelaria, who is 44 years old, did not attend school. She has a partner who works as an employee in a town hall. She has three children who are adults.
For the last eight years, Candelaria has worked selling tortillas. She started the business because of the need to generate an income for her family.
She needs the loan to buy maize and firewood in large amounts, to buy it cheaper and in this way cover her needs and continue with her business.
Her dream is to improve her quality of life and improve her house with the income that she gets from her tortilla sales.

loans.use: to buy maize and firewood in large amounts.

loans.name: Delmi Antonia

texts.es:
Delmi, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada, su pareja es motorista de las rutas de buses que llegan hasta su comunidad, juntos tienen dos hijas que están pequeñas y viven en casa propia.

Delmi, se dedica a vender ropa para niños y adultos en su cantón desde hace tres años, ella decidió realizar este negocio porque quiere ayudarle a su pareja con los ingresos y vende de lunes a jueves.

Delmi, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ropa, porque se acerca la temporada de diciembre que es cuando se vende más, de esa manera tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.

Delmi, sueña con llegar a tener un negocio más grande de ropa, esto le servirá para mejorar su negocio y darle lo mejor a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Delmi is 32 years old. She studied up until the fourth grade. She is in a relationship, and her partner is a bus driver who drives the routes which reach their community. Together they have two young daughters and they live in their own home. 

Delmi sells clothing for children and adults in her village and has done so for three years. She decided to begin this business because she wanted to support her partner with an income. She sells from Monday to Thursday. 

She needs this loan to purchase clothing because the holiday season is coming up and this is when she sells the most. In this way she will improve her quality of life. Dalmi's dream is that she will one day have a larger clothing store which would improve her business and enable her to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Ratnawati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is one of Ruma’s agents, Ratnawati. Ratnawati lives in Bekasi, the satellite city around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Ratnawati lives there with her husband and her two children. Right now, she is becoming a mobile airtime credits agent for Ruma as well as selling small snacks and drinks. As a woman, she wanted to join Ruma because she wants to help her husband improve their life and learn about how to start up a business, as well as make more of a contribution to her community.

As the business keeps growing, Ratnawati is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Ratnawati improves her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services.
