As seen in the photo, Ratnawati is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is maize farmer from Dion Sabo village. As a member of Babban Gona, Thomas is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Thomas would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Thomas can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thomas is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end he hopes to use his increased earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Musa

texts.en:
Alhaji Musa is a maize farmer from Gadanga village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alhaji Musa is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Musa can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alhaji Musa is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end he hopes to use his increased earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Inés Margarita

texts.es: Inés es una mujer trabajadora y una madre amorosa de seis hijos que reside con su cónyuge en una urbanización de Cartagena, ella es propietaria de un puesto de verduras, frutas y tubérculos que adquirió en el año 2008, actividad que desarrolla con mucho compromiso y dedicación de lunes a sábado a partir de las 5 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. Inés logra vender a transeúntes del lugar frutas de temporada, papa, yuca, plátanos, pimentones, ají, cebollas y toda una variedad de alimentos que le dan buen sabor y un gran aporte de nutrientes a la comida, y que los Cartageneros usan a diario es por ello que su negocio le ha permitido incrementar el ingreso familiar y así gozar de beneficios. En la actualidad Inés realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar estanterías y exhibir mucho más surtido, con lo que logrará incrementar sus ventas puesto que los clientes podrán ver más cantidad y les dará muchas más alternativas de compra. A futuro Inés se proyecta en un local comercial con muchas más comodidades.
texts.en:
Ines is a hardworking woman and a loving mother of six children. She lives with her partner in an urban area of Cartagena. She is the owner of a fruit, vegetable and tuber stand, which she acquired in 2008. She has developed this business with a lot of commitment and dedication, and works Monday through Saturday from 5:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.

Ines manages to sell seasonal fruits, potatoes, cassava, plantains, peppers, chilies, onions and a whole variety of foods to passers-by. Her products are ones that Cartagena residents use daily and that give good taste and nutrition to dishes. For this reason her business has allowed her to increase her family's income and therefore enjoy other benefits.

Ines is asking for a Kiva loan in order to have the opportunity to access financial markets through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in order to purchase shelves and exhibit many more products. In this way she will be able to increase her sales since her customers will be able to see more quantity, giving them more purchasing options.

In the future Ines sees herself in a shop with many more commodities.

loans.use: to purchase shelves and exhibit more products.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Ali is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Ali would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Ali can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ali has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Ali is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maitala

texts.en:
Maitala is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Maitala has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Maitala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Maitala can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Maitala will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Maitala is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gladys Margoth

texts.es: Gladys es una madre soltera de una niña de dos años de edad que por efectos de la ola invernal ocurrida en su lugar de residencia fue reubicada en una urbanización de Cartagena de indias, lugar que le permitió mejorar sus condiciones de habitabilidad y salubridad, así como las posibilidades de tener su propio negocio.  Ella empezó a laborar en tiendas de barrio desde sus 18 años de edad y en el año 2010, cuando llegó a su nueva vivienda consideró que ésta sería la oportunidad que estaba esperando para dar inicio a su propia tienda de víveres en las instalaciones de su vivienda.  Con pocos recursos compró un enfriador botellero y surtido para su negocio, así empezó a funcionar y en la actualidad lleva cinco años en esta actividad con excelentes resultados. Gladys realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para mejorar sus inventarios y comprar una vitrina para surtirla con útiles de papelería; retmas, lapices, lapiceros, borradores, tajalápiz, marcadores, entre otros.  Esta inversión será de éxito y la acercará a su meta de ampliar sus servicios e incorporar servicio de internet.
texts.en:
Gladys is a single mother of a two year old girl who, because of the effects of the flooding which took place in her place of residence, was relocated to a residential area in Cartagena de Indias. This place allowed her to improve her habitat and health conditions, as well as have the possibility of owning her own business.

She started to work in neighborhood stores since 2010 when she was 18 years old. When she arrived at her new home, she considered that this could be the opportunity she was waiting for to start her own general store on the premises of her new home. She bought a bottle chiller and stock for her business with little resources and began to operate like this. Now, she has been running this business for five years with excellent results.

Gladys put in a request for a Kiva loan, which is an opportunity to connect herself to the financial life through Fundación Mario Santa Domingo, in order to improve her inventory and buy a display case to stock with stationery supplies like reams of paper, pencils, pens, erasers, sharpeners, and markers, among others. This investment will be a success and will bring her closer to her goal of expanding her services and adding internet service.

loans.use: to buy a display case to stock it with stationery supplies: reams of paper, pencils, pens, erasers, sharpeners, and markers, among others.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer from Dion Sabo village. As a Babban Gona member, she is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize at harvest time when the price of maize is at its lowest in order to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Hauwa can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to a 15,640 NGN loan and the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hauwa no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, she hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to buy a motorbike with which to do business.

loans.use: to store her maize harvest until a later date when she will be able to sell it at a higher price.

loans.name: Alh. Sahabi

texts.en:
Alh. Sahabi is maize farmer from Hazo village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alh. Sahabi is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Sahabi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Sahabi can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alh. Sahabi is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end he hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба жительница города Худжанд. Ей 44 года, она хорошая жена, прекрасная мать и любящая бабушка.  Махбуба на протяжении 5 лет занимается шитьем. В этом деле ей помогает ее невестка.  Махбуба очень ответственно подходит к своей работе и поэтому она заслужила хорошую репутацию среди своих клиентов. В данный момент дом, в котором проживает Махбуба, нуждается в капитальном ремонте.  Она хочет поскорей до наступления зимы сделать в доме ремонт и утеплить его. С этой целью она обратилась к Вам за помощью. Она надеется на то, что Вы поддержите ее в этом начинании.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is a resident of the city of Khujand.  She is 44, a good wife, a beautiful mom, and a beloved grandmother.  She has been working as a seamstress for the past five years.  Her daughter-in-law helps her with this activity. Mahbuba is very responsible when it comes to her work and she has acquired a good reputation among her customers.

At the moment, the house in which Mahbuba lives needs to be thoroughly renovated.  With winter approaching, she would like to renovate her house as soon as possible so that it can be properly heated.  With this goal in mind, she is turning to you for some support.  She is hopeful that you will support her in this endeavor.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate her house.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is a 23-year-old married lady. In 2006 she started working with her mother selling clothes and sports shoes in a shop. She is a hardworking woman who puts so much effort in developing her business.

She quit school during her intermediate level, started selling clothes and shoes, and acquired good experience. Since every business must maintain stability to achieve development and continuity, Nour decided to acquire a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise with a special winter clothes collection.

She hopes to provide her customers with a continuous updated and newly-released collection.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special winter clothes collection.

loans.name: Jean-D'arc

texts.en: Jean-D’arc is a 57-year-old Lebanese married woman and mother of three children, one of whom is still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life. Despite the bad financial situation, she is requesting today a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her child’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register him with the new school year and that makes her very optimistic.

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en: Khouloud is a 28-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and mother of two children, all of whom are still attending school. Her husband works as a soldier in the Lebanese army to always be ready to ensure his family a good life. Today, Khouloud looks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational installment fees. This is her first loan from Kiva and she is definitely eager to request additional loans in the future that will help her to ensure a good education path for them.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational installment fees

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.es:
Cristobal, de 68 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado, su pareja tiene un negocio de ropa en el centro de su comunidad y juntos tienen hijos, pero solo dos viven con ellos porque están pequeños.

Cristobal, desde que se acompaño empezó a trabajar de jornalero, pero después compro un vehículo para hacer viajes a los vecinos y para el uso de ellos.

 
Cristobal, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para vender, porque se acerca la temporada de diciembre, que es cuando más se vende la ropa.

Cristobal, sueña con que su negocio de ropa crezca, para seguir ayudándole a su esposa y sus dos hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Cristobal, who is 68 years old, studied until the third grade. He has a partner who has a clothing business in the center of the community and together they have children. Only two of their children live with them because they are still young.
Cristobal, since he started cohabiting, began working as a day laborer, but later purchased a vehicle to take the neighbors on trips and so they can use it.
He needs the loan to buy clothing to sell, because the December season is approaching, which is when more clothing is sold.
He dreams that his clothing business will grow, to keep helping his wife and his two young children.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell, because the December season is approaching.

loans.name: Nazaruddin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Nazaruddin, one of Ruma's agents. Nazaruddin lives in Bekasi, the satellite city located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Nazaruddin is a young guy who has big spirit to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall where he sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for his community. He feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he has learned a lot about how to manage his business, as well as about how to manage and increase his savings.

As the business grows, Nazaruddin is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Nazaruddin improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Nazaruddin is the one who is sitting in his own small stall. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc.) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu will store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Maryamu now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members. She would like to use this additional income to buy maize-grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alti

texts.en:
Alti is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alti has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alti would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alti can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alti will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alti is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family. She looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lesbia Eugenia

texts.es:
LESBIA DE 47 AÑOS DE EDAD ES ORIGINARIA  DE MANAGUA, MADRES SOLTERA CON UN HIJO MENOR DE EDAD, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPANIA DE SUS HIJOS,   EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA PARA SALIR ADELANTE Y BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE ELLOS NO TUBIERON.
GRACIA A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA SALA DE BELLEZA LA CUAL ESTA UBICADO EN EL MERCADO ORIENTAL, TIENE QUINCE AÑOS DE DESEMPEÑAR SU NEGOCIO, ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIES HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS SERVICIOS, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y Y SURTIR CON: TINTES, BASE, PINTURAS DE  UÑAS, ALISADORES, SOMBRAS, PLANCHA DE PELO, SECADORAS, UÑAS ACRILICAS ETC. LESBIA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Lesbia is 47 years old and is from Managua. She is a single mother with one young son. She is known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire to improve herself.

In her free time she likes to enjoy the company of her children. She is currently struggling to get ahead and offer her children opportunities they haven't had. Thanks to her yearning to get ahead she has a beauty salon business located in the eastern market. She has been in this business for 15 years and works offering her services 10 hours a day.

The objective of the loan is to invest in work capital and products such as: dyes, foundation, nail polish, eye shadows, a hair straightening iron, blowdryers, acrylic nails, etc.

She is grateful for the help the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that people can have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her beauty salon with products such as lipsticks, nail polish, foundation, compact vanity mirrors, eyeliners,  etc.

loans.name: Lucio Juan

texts.es:
Lucio continúa con su negocio de venta de cereales. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprar cereales y semillas por mayor, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo distribuir la mercadería correctamente. Actualmente las ventas son continuas, vende por mayor y menor y también realiza entregas, un tubérculo muy popular se cultiva en estas épocas es la maca muy conocida por sus propiedades curativas y sanadoras,, “sigo mejorando mi negocio y ofreciendo nuevos productos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la competencia es poca, la desventaja son los paros de transporte porque no puede movilizarse a entregar pedidos. Su sueño es viajar a otras ciudades a vender sus productos, Él desea comprar ‘maca’ por mayor para ofertar nuevos productos naturales. Esta es la 5 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lucio solicita un préstamo para comprar ‘maca’ por mayor para ofertar nuevos productos naturales.
texts.en:
Lucio continues with his business of selling cereals. The loan he got was used to buy cereal and seeds wholesale. His loan payments were punctual as he was able to distribute his product well. Currently his sales are continuous. He sells retail and wholesale and he also makes deliveries.

A root that is very popular in these times is maca (Lepidium meyenii) which is very well-known for its curative and healing properties. "My business continues to improve and I am offering new products", he comments. The advantage of his business is that he has little competition. His disadvantage is the transport strikes as he can't get around to deliver orders. His dream is to travel to other cities to sell his products.

He wants to buy maca wholesale to offer new natural products. This is his 5th loan with the institution in the 20 years he has been running this business.

For these reasons Lucio is requesting a loan to buy maca wholesale to offer new natural products.

loans.use: to buy Maca (Lepidium meyenii) wholesale to offer new natural products.

loans.name: Carla

texts.en: Carla is a 21-year-old single Lebanese woman. She lives with her parents who cooperate together and represent the main source of income. Carla is still attending university and also works as an administrative assistant in a hospital. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family members. Today she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her university educational fees. She said that she is very happy with the loan that will allow her to continue her education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her university educational fees

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 40-year-old married woman living with her husband. She is a mother of six children, one of whom is a school-aged child. Her husband is the main income provider; he is a hard worker in order to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to pay the registration fees for her child. She said that she is very satisfied and willing to benefit from Kiva’s loan to continue his education suitably.

loans.use: to pay the registration fees for her child

loans.name: Abagambakamu Kyomukama Group

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Angelina is a widowed lady charged with a responsibility of taking care of four children who all attend school in Kagadi, Uganda. She works hard throughout the whole week in order to earn money to enable her to take good care of her family. As a loving mother, Angelina is determined to educate her children to a level of sustaining themselves when they acquire jobs.

She deals in fresh foods alongside farming and produce selling. She is faced with challenges of seasonal markets for her products and high rate of perishability of her fresh foods. In spite of this, she is looking forward to expanding her business and becoming a leading farmer in her area. Through group guarantorship, Angelina is requesting a loan to buy stock of fresh foods like tomatoes and produce such as maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of fresh foods like tomatoes and produce such as maize to sell.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Salina has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Salina would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Salina can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Salina will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Salina is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family. She looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zakari

texts.en:
Zakari is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Zakari has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Zakari would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Zakari can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Zakari will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Zakari is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: 27 летняя молодая, красивая и талантливая девушка Гуландом. Имеет среднее образование. Не замужем. Живет с мамой и сестрой. Шить она научилась у тети. В этой сфере Гуландом уже работает 3 года. Как говорят ее близкие, она очень старательная и трудолюбивая. Гуландом шьет национальные женские платья. В наше время техника идет вперед. И Гуландом хочет приобрести современную швейную машину. Но по сложившимся обстоятельствам Гуландом не в состоянии купить ее. Поэтому она обратилась к Вам за помощью. В надежде на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Meet Gulandom, a 27-year-old talented and lovely young woman.  Gulandom has a secondary education.  She is single and lives with her mom and sister.  Gulandom learned how to sew from an aunt, and she has now been involved in this activity for the past three years.  Her relatives describe her as diligent and hardworking.  Gulandom sews traditional Tajik dresses for women.  The sewing technique is fast evolving in this field, so Gulandom would like to buy a modern sewing machine.  However, because of her current personal circumstances, she is not in a position to make this type of purchase.  For this reason, she is turning to you for a loan and she's hoping to receive your support.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is a 27-year-old married woman living with her husband and mother of one child. Her husband is the main income source in the family, and she is a housewife taking care of her family. Due to the hard financial circumstances and with the aim to help her child with his education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay his school educational fees. Her only dream is to ensure him a happy life.

loans.use: to help her child with his education

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 37-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working for five years at her house selling homemade foods such as pickles, thyme, and oil, to help her family to meet the needs of life. Today, Rima is obtaining a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to improve her business merchandise to give the best product to her clients. She is very sure that she will sell all of her products and expand her business area. She hopes that in the future, she might open her own store and attract more customers.

loans.use: to improve her business merchandise.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 3 años y una hija de 6 meses, y su negocio es la venta de papa.
Ella es resistente, libre y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘palcoco’ caracterizada por encontrarse cercano al lago sagrado Titicaca, los pobladores se dedican mayormente a la pesca, agricultura y ganadería, el clima es muy frio y seco.
Rosmery es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de adobe con techo de paja que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no cuenta con agua potable ni alcantarillado porque no existe el servicio en el lugar. Su negocio es la venta de papa natural y deshidratada como ‘el chuño’ y ‘la tunta’ que son el resultado de la deshidratación de la papa para mantenerlo conservado por largo tiempo, el método de desecación que se utiliza consiste en exponer la papa a ciclos de congelación y asoleamiento de forma continua, en cada repetición, la papa pierde agua hasta que el calor del sol y cierto prensado a pie acaban el trabajo. La fabricación de chuño es estacional y está sujeta a condiciones meteorológicas que garanticen la presencia de heladas intensas, “llega la temporada de venta de cuño, yo compro por mayor y lo guardo hasta la época donde escasea para venderla a mejor precio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es independiente y tiene tiempo para cuidar de su familia, la desventaja son los días de compra porque debe trabajar desde comienzos de la madrugada. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida, ella desea comprar chuño por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para comprar chuño por mayor para vender en temporada alta.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a 24 years old. She lives with her partner and has a son who is 3 years old and a daughter who is 6 months old. Her business is selling potatoes.

Rosmery is resilient, free and very hardworking. She conducts her business in the town of Paicoco, characterized for its proximity to the sacred lake Titicaca. The majority of its population works in fishing, agriculture and raising cattle. The climate is cold and dry.

Rosmery is brown-skinned, with long black hair that she wears braided. She wears traditional dress (hat, blanket and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks at home, and she speaks Spanish outside the home and in her business. She lives with her partner, who works in agriculture, and her children, who are not yet of schooling age. They live in a home owned by the family constructed with adobe with a straw roof. Their home has electricity but does not have running water or a sewage system because these services are not available in the area.

Rosmery's business is selling natural and dehydrated potatoes like "el chuño" and "la tunta," which are produced by the dehydration of potatoes in order to preserve them for a long time. The method of drying that is used consists of exposing the potatoes to a continuous cycle of freezing and sunlight. In each cycle, the potato loses water until the heat from the sunlight and pressing finish the job. The making of "el chuño" is seasonal and subject to weather conditions that guarantee the presence of intense frosts. "In the season for selling el chuño, I buy them wholesale and save it until supply is scarce to sell them at a better price...", she says. The advantage of her business is that it is independent and she has time to take care of her family. The disadvantage is that on days to purchase the chuño, she works from the early morning. Her dream is to improve her quality of life. She wishes to buy chuño wholesale. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 4 years that she has worked at this business.

It is for these reasons that Rosmery is applying for a loan to buy chuño wholesale to sell in high season.

loans.use: to buy chuño wholesale to sell it in high season.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en: Zahraa is a 25-year-old married woman living with her husband. She is mother of one child attending school. She is a housewife dedicated only to her family. Her husband works in the Lebanese army as a soldier and is the main income provider in order to fulfill their family's needs. Because of the difficult living conditions, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay the first installment of school fees for her child. This is the first time that she requests Kiva’s support to pay the school fees. She is very happy because she will be able to register him for the school year.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of school fees for her child.

loans.name: Itab

texts.en: Itab is a 19-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. She started working in the agriculture field three years ago. She likes her occupation so much because she likes to feel her independence. She cooperates with her siblings to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, she is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase agriculture tools for her business in order to improve it. She is very positive about her future and wishes to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture tools for her business

loans.name: Bashari

texts.en:
Bashari is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Bashari is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Bashari would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Bashari can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Bashari has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Bashari is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize-grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Neri Elmer Ivan

texts.es:
Neri, de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a realizar los quehaceres del hogar, tienen tres hijos que ya están casados y viven en casa alquilada.

Neri, desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa y zapatos en el centro de la ciudad, este negocio lo aprendió por la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia, porque el es albañil de profesión, pero actualmente hay poco trabajo; es por ese que tuvo que comprar ropa para vender y recibir ingresos, su horario de venta es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.

Neri, necesita el préstamo para comprar más zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños, porque se acerca la temporada de diciembre y la venta de ropa incrementa. 

El sueño de Neri, es tener el negocio y comprar un local fijo para vender.
texts.en:
Neri, 63 years old, studied through high school. He is in a common-law marriage, and his partner makes a living doing household chores. They have three children that are already married and live in a rental home.  

For several years, Neri has made a living selling clothing and shoes in the downtown area of the city. He learned this business out of necessity to earn income for his family because he is a construction worker but there is currently little work. 

Due to this, he had to purchase clothing to sell to make a profit. His work schedule is from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM.    

Neri needs a loan in order to buy more women, men and children’s shoes as the holiday season is nearing and the sale of clothing increases. 

His dream is to have a business and to purchase a local shop from which to sell.

loans.use: to buy more women, men and children’s shoes for holiday season.

loans.name: Surajo

texts.en:
Surajo is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Surajo is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Surajo would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Surajo will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Surajo now has the opportunity to realize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Aminu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Aminu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Aminu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Aminu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Aliyu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Aliyu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Aliyu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Aliyu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Трудолюбивая и добрая девушка Тахмина. Ей 21 год. Молодая жена любящего мужа. Она талантливая девушка. Тахмина швея. Шитью она научилась у матери. Этим она занимается уже 6 лет. В семье у них царит гармония. Муж ей доверяет и поддерживает во всех ее начинаниях. Недавно у мужа Тахмины сломалась машина. Для починки машины молодой семье нужны средства, но так как недавно, состоялась их свадьба и у них нет нужной суммы. За помощью Тахмина обращается к Вам. В надежде на поддержку. За счет кредит муж Тахмины купить автозапчасти и оплатить за услуги мастера.
texts.en:
Tahmina is a kind and hardworking young woman.  She is 21 years old and recently married to a devoted husband.  She is also a very talented seamstress.  She learned how to sew from her mother and has now been involved in this activity for the past six years.  Harmony prevails in the family.  Her husband trusts her and supports her in all her endeavors.

Recently, the car used by Tahmina's husband broke down.  The young family needs money to repair their car, but because they just celebrated their wedding, they don't have the amount of money necessary for those repairs.  Tahmina is therefore turning to you and is hoping to receive your support.  She will use her loan to buy auto spare parts and to pay for the mechanic's labor.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts and to pay for the mechanic's labor.

loans.name: Alicia Fotunata

texts.es:
La socia Alicia continua  dedicándose a su negocio de  restaurante donde sirve almuerzos y cenas para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua elaborando diferentes platos típicos como caldos, y pollo al horno entre otros platos,  la socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida por ser cliente de Arariwa y se ha comprometido a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota a tiempo.
texts.en:
Member Alicia continues to dedicate herself to her restaurant business where she serves lunch and dinner to her customers. Alicia is successfully running her business, which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She continues to prepare different typical dishes such as caldos (a type of soup), baked chicken and other dishes. She is a determined and hardworking woman and hopes that her business will earn more profits and in this way she will be able to continue supporting her family.

She is applying for this loan to buy supplies such as rice and oil, among others.

Alicia is very thankful to be a client of Arariwa and is committed to meeting her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice and oil, among others.

loans.name: Nueva Luz De Poromate Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Nueva Luz de Poromate” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en la comunidad de Poromate del distrito de Vilcabamba de la provincia de La Convención, Cusco, Perú.


Valentina es una de las nuevas socias del banco comunal "Nueva luz de Poromate", ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores.
La socia tiene 50 años de edad y aporta gastos familiares gracias a estas dos actividades.
La socia desea ampliar su negocio de crianza de animales menores, es por ello que la socia solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz y pasto para sus animales.
Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, venta de abarrotes y otros brindan servicios profesionales.
Los socios están contentos y agradecen los inversionistas de KIVA  por el crédito otorgado, se comprometen a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Nueva Luz de Poromate” from the Asociación Arariwa, and live in the community of Poromate in the district of Vilcabamba in the province of La Convencion, Cusco Peru.
Valentina is one of the new members of the communal bank "Nueva luz de Poromate". She is a hard-working woman who works in agriculture and raising small animals.
She is 50 years old and contributes to the family expenses thanks to these two occupations.
She wishes to expand her business of raising small animals, this is why she asked for the loan, to buy maize and grass for her animals.
The other members work in livestock, agriculture, food sales, grocery sales, and others provide professional services.
They are happy and they thank Kiva investors for the given loan. They are committed to making payments on time.

loans.use: to buy maize and grass.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 40 años de edad, estudio solo primer grado, está acompañado, su pareja le apoya a elaborar hamacas y matatas, en su casa vive solo con dos hijos, porque los otros ya se acompañaron.

Carlos, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la elaboración de hamacas y también a la agricultura sembrando maíz y 
frijoles, sus dos hijos le ayudan a trabajar de lunes a sábado, de seis a cuatro de la tarde.

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la elaboración hamacas y para cortar la cosecha, porque tiene que pagarles a varios mozos para que le ayuden, de esa manera lograra mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

El sueño de Carlos, es que sus dos hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Carlos, 40, only attended first grade. He's married and his wife helps him make hammocks and matatas [woven bags]. He lives in his home with only two of his children, because the others are already married.

Carlos has worked for many years making hammocks and also growing corn and beans. His two children help him work from Monday through Saturday, from 4 to 6 in the afternoon.

Carlos needs the loan to buy materials to make hammocks and to cut the harvest. He has to pay several employees who help him. That way he'll be able to improve his quality of life and his family's.

Carlos's dream is for his children to attend school and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy materials to make hammocks and to cut the harvest

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Musa will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Musa now has the opportunity to realize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ravshangul

texts.ru: Равшангул общительная и умная женщина. У нее 4 детей. Три дочери и один сын. Им по 19, 18, 16 и 13 лет. Старшие дочки студентки, а младшие школьники. Муж Равшангул работает в России. Сама Равшангул швея. Она имеет 2 летний опыт. Она шьет национальные платья и шторы. Этому Равшангул научилась у соседки. Работа ей приносит хороший доход. Благодаря ремеслу  Рашангул кормит свою семью. Для продолжения учебы дочери, Равшангулу нужна, оплатить сумму договора. Ей не хватает денежных средств. Из-за нехватки Равшангул просит Вас о помощи. И надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Ravshangul is a sociable and intelligent woman.  She has four children (three daughters and one son) who are now 19, 18, 16, and 13 years old.  Her oldest daughters are university students; her youngest children are still in school.  Ravshangul's husband works in Russia while Ravshangul herself works as a seamstress.  She has two years of experience in this field.  She sews traditional Tajik dresses as well as curtains.  She learned this trade from one of her neighbors.  Her work brings her a good income and, thanks to this activity, she is able to feed her family.

Ravshangul needs to pay her daughter's university fees so that she can pursue her education.  However, she doesn't have enough money, so for this reason, she is turning to you.  She hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education.
